results.description:
You are cordially invited to attend the eighth annual Blind Legislative Informational Networking Day 2016 on Thursday, March 24, 2016, from 11:30 AM – 2:00 PM in The Great Hall, at The Massachusetts State House in Boston.

Register for this event today!


Purpose:

To advocate for legislative support of the FY2017 budget and funding recommendations that recognize the necessity for specialized "wrap-around" blindness services and their vital importance to legally blind residents of all ages. Some of these critical services include Orientation & Mobility, Rehabilitation Teaching, Assistive Technology, and accessible library services.

The Governor’s proposed budget for FY2017 has recommended level-funding for most of the Massachusetts Commission for the Blind (MCB) state appropriations, along with the Perkins and Worcester Library programs.

The Perkins Library and the Worcester Talking Book Library – The[masked] &[masked] line item accounts provide funding for the continued operations of the Perkins Library and the Worcester Talking Book Library for the delivery of audio, braille and large print accessible library services. The proposed fiscal year 2017 funding level will allow for the continuation of modest outreach to the 100,000 potentially eligible borrowers in the Commonwealth who are not aware of the program. Ongoing support for accessible library services is essential to meet expanding information and technology access needs.
MCB's Community Service account [masked]) includes funding for support for the Community Mobility and Orientation Program which provides vital travel training for clients in their home and communities. This service is provided both by MCB staff as well as the Carroll Center for the Blind. This account also supports the Deaf-Blind Community Access Network (DBCAN) providing essential independent living services to people who are deafblind. Rates for both of these services are being adjusted based on Chapter 257.
MCB's Turning 22 account [masked]) covers supports and services for more severely disabled youth who are blind or visually impaired transitioning out of the special education system as well as for their continued care as adults.
General support for the special education circuit-breaker funding for Chapter 766 school tuition rates is needed.
At this important time, the blindness community is working to both provide information and network with legislators on the need for appropriate funding for the blindness community’s unique service needs.

Please complete the online registration form. This will make it possible for event planners to provide you with follow-up email with additional details on this event including directions to the State House meeting room and your representative and senator’s names and office locations.

Please come to the State House on Thursday, March 24th and add your voice to our advocacy efforts!


Program Schedule:

11:30 am – 12:00 pm: Light buffet lunch with legislators / access product demonstrations
12:00 pm – 1:15 pm: Award / Consumer Presentations
1:15 pm – 2:00 pm and beyond: Networking, walk around the State House to visit representative and senators’ offices
For other questions, or to register by phone, please contact Debby King, B.L.I.N.D. 2016 Registration Coordinator, at[masked] or [masked].

For any State House accommodations requests, please contact Carl Richardson by March 14, 2016 at[masked] or via email at [masked].

Talking points and legislative contact information will be distributed in a future email communication prior to the event; with hard copy print and braille materials available on March 24th. If you are unable to join us on Thursday, March 24th, you can still help by contacting your elected officials.

There is a new way-finding system in the State House called Click & Go Maps. Using this service, one can access detailed walking directions between various landmarks both outside and inside the building, as well as descriptions of various points of interest. As an alternative to web access and free downloads of this way-finding data, access can be made via a free telephone call using interactive voice response technology. The telephone access number is (888) 617-7402.

To check out the State House online, you can visit Click & Go at: http://www.clickandgomaps.com/msh.


​B.L.I.N.D. Sponsors

Bay State Council of the Blind
Carroll Center for the Blind
Lowell Association for the Blind
Massachusetts Association for the Blind and Visually Impaired
National Braille Press
National Federation of the Blind of Massachusetts
Perkins School for the Blind on behalf of the Friends of the Braille & Talking Book Library and the Worcester Talking Book Library
Talking Information Center
Thank you for being a part of the eighth annual B.L.I.N.D. State House event on March 24, 2016.

results.description:
This is a webcast - https://www.brighttalk.com/webcast/13685/194115

Apache Apex is an open source stream processing and next generation analytics platform incubating at the Apache Software Foundation. Apex is a next generation native Hadoop platform and was built from ground up for scalability, low-latency processing, high availability and operability. 

In this webinar you will learn about Apache Apex fault tolerance, high availability and processing guarantees.

From the users perspective, fault tolerance of a stream processing platform should cover the state of the application/processor and the in-flight data. In the event of failure, the platform should recover, restore state and resume processing with no loss of data. We will cover:

- Components of an Apex application and how they are made fault tolerant

- How native YARN support is leveraged for fault tolerance

- How operator checkpointing works and how the user can tune it

- Failure scenarios, recovery from failures, incremental recovery

- Processing guarantees and which option is appropriate for your application

- Sample topology for highly available, low latency real-time processing

- How is fault-tolerance in Apex different from similar platforms such as Storm, Spark Streaming and Flink

Presenter: Thomas Weise - A Hadoop veteran, and PPMC member Apache Apex
results.how_to_find_us: It is an online Webcast
results.name: Fault Tolerance and Processing Semantics with Apache Apex

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Thursday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

This StartupBlink lecture by our CEO (Eli David) will focus on tools and methodology for gaining startup traction. 

Eli will explain how his StartupBlink team gained media attention from various publications and opinion leaders, including CNN, Forbes, Product hunt, and Guy Kawasaki, all without a marketing budget. 

We will also discuss ways of finding the right marketing channels for startups and building a process to utilize each channel successfully while constantly searching for new marketing channels.

results.description:
Science Shaping Our World-SHOW is an ongoing seminar and networking series that highlights cutting edge translational life science research and development. Our mission is to bring together a multidisciplinary audience spanning academia and industry providing exposure and insight into the life science advancements changing our world.

March 2016 will kick off a series of SHOW events focused on the science and the art of building dynamic network relationships. Although research plays a key role in driving innovation, relationships also play an important part in creating the necessary opportunities to bring about extraordinary and dynamic change in science and medicine.

Strong professional networks can be advantageous in all areas such as nucleating novel research collaborations, business development opportunities, new venture creation, professional development and/or career advancement. Networks within your area of expertise or business are powerful but even more powerful are networks that break down verticals and bridge silos, such as academia vs industry. As hybrid skills and diverse relationships grow in demand, how can we gain this expertise and build these relationships –> by networking with diverse people outside of your field…. which is easier said than done!

Leading March’s SHOW event will be career strategist extraordinaire, Sarah Cardozo Duncan. Sarah is an accomplished networker who will be sharing her knowledge and insight on relationship building and strategy. Following the introduction, the remainder of the evening will be an opportunity to put Sarah’s strategies into action, meet new colleagues from outside of your field/outside of your industry, and enrich your network of relationships.

Also, joining us for this event will be an awesome group of special guest "networkers" that will be stationed strategically around the venue space so as to allow for effective access by all attendees and maximum networking diversification!

Special guests networking representatives include:
•Vijayalakshmi Agnani, M.S., MBA, Head of Office, External Innovation Operations, Strategy, Science Policy and External Innovation at Sanofi
•Howie Chun-Hau Chen, Ph.D., Instructor Level Researcher Focused on Age-related Disease Research at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
•Amanda A Fitzgerald, Ph.D., Scientific Account Manager at Genedata
•Silva Krause, Ph.D.-Senior Scientist in Translational Medicine at Momenta
•Rafael Luna, Ph.D.-Program Director at Harvard Medical School/ CEO Luna Scientific Storytelling
•Keri Siggers, Ph.D.-Regulatory Affairs Manager at Genzyme
•Janet Tse, Sc.D.-Patent Agent at Wolf, Greenfield & Sacks, P.C.
•Jessica Tytell, Ph.D.-Market Development Manager, RNA at Firefly Bioworks
•Gordon Webster, Ph.D.-Digital Biologist, Research Scholar at the Ronin Institute, and Partner at Amber Biology LLC

Please join us for an amazing evening of science, innovation, and networking. Event registration is required with event sign-in beginning at 5:30 PM.

Networking introduction and discussion will follow from ~6:30 PM – 7:00 PM. Further, you are encouraged to bring your business cards, and enthusiasm, for an evening of networking following the introduction from 7:00 PM-9:00 PM. Light food and refreshments will be provided.


Price $15
Date: Thursday, March 24, 2016
Time: 5:30PM – 9:00 PM
Location: Boston Children's Hospital
Auditorium B
1 Autumn Street
Boston, MA 02115

Science Shaping Our World-SHOW:Networking at the Intersection of Science and Business: Diversifying Your Relationships  [Munevar & Associates, Inc./Boston Children’s Hospital Office of Fellowship Training (OFT) ]


To Register: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/science-shaping-our-world-shownetworking-at-the-intersection-of-science-and-business-diversifying-registration-21485207835

results.description:
Come network, hear how Machine Learning and Elasticsearch can be combined and see how Datadog leverages Elasticsearch. Food and refreshments will be provided. Datadog is hosting us but for security reasons, they may not be able to accommodate ad-hoc visitors. So please make sure to RSVP if you want to attend. 

Extending the Elastic Stack with Machine Learning

Abstract
Prelert's machine learning-based behavioral analytics platform extends and accelerates the value you derive from the Elastic Stack by automatically detecting abnormal behavior patterns in your data - thus identifying changes that can impact application performance/availability or identifying behaviors that may be indicative of advanced security threats. Through Rich Collier's work across a broad spectrum of organizations implementing advanced analytics, he has several key use cases of significant benefit to Elastic users at any stage of adoption.

Speaker Bio
Rich Collier – Director Customer Solutions, Prelert. Rich has over 20 years experience as a Solutions Architect / Pre-Sales Systems Engineer for high-end software, hardware, and service solutions. Rich’s technical specialties include:  Big data analytics, Machine learning, Anomaly detection, Threat detection, Security Operations, Application Performance Management, Web Applications, and Contact Center Technologies.

Elasticsearch at Datadog

Abstract
Datadog is a SaaS-based infrastructure monitoring company. We process billions of data points every day including metrics and events. Metrics are things like CPU utilization, database keys, queue lengths and more. Events are more varied and include completed Chef job notifications, GitHub commits, and Docker container status. Storing this information and being able to make use of it in our Stream and our Dashboards is challenging. We started with Postgres like many of you probably did. But as our needs grew, we moved to various configurations of Elastic, learning as we went. Elastic is now a core component in how we can do what we do, indexing vast numbers of events every second. In this talk, you will see how Datadog uses an Elastic cluster to create a fast and efficient environment for thousands of customers and how we keep an eye on it to ensure it stays that way.

Speaker Bio
Matt Williams is the DevOps Evangelist at Datadog. He is passionate about the power of monitoring and metrics to make large-scale systems stable and manageable. So he tours the country speaking and writing about monitoring with Datadog. When he's not on the road, he's coding. You can find Matt on Twitter at @Technovangelist.
results.name: ES & Machine Learning, ES @ Datadog

results.description:
Are you curious about programming or thinking about pursuing a career in software engineering? 

Then RSVP on this meet-up page for this 2-hour Intro to Coding class happening in the Boston area at CIC Boston. Learn the basics of programming, do hands-on exercises, and enjoy some food and drinks while meeting new people. All for free!

The class is being taught by MakerSquare, which runs some of the top coding schools in the country.

Class officially starts at 6:30pm, but please arrive at CIC Boston by 6pm to enjoy pizza, drinks and to mingle with your fellow classmates. We will end at 9pm, with the last 30 minutes being an optional Q&A session.

What will I learn during the class?

This beginner ­level class will contain several instructor-guided exercises. The class will cover the following topics:

   1. Overview of programming 

   2. Intro to data & data structures

   3. Basics of functions

We ask that you read the Prerequisites section before the start of class and bring your own laptop (Windows, Mac or Linux) with Google Chrome installed.

What is MakerSquare Boston?

MakerSquare is a three-month full-time school for software engineering. By teaching computer science fundamentals and modern web languages like JavaScript, we prepare students to join top flight engineering teams.

We have campuses all over the country, and are excited to be opening a campus in Boston. The free Intro to Coding class is to introduce more people to the wonderful world of programming and to get the community excited about the launch of our full-time class in Boston in July 2016!

Questions? Email us at [masked].
results.name: Free Intro to Coding Class (Thurs March 24, 6-9pm)

Welcome back to the Cash Game Island, where the blinds are .25/.50 and the game is dealer's choice or no limit holdem. There is no minimum buyin and the max is 400 bb ($200.) There is no rake, tipping, donation, or seat fee. House rules are posted below:

If it's your first time at one of my games RSVP on meetup then text, email, or call to confirm your RSVP and receive the address. If you RSVP and no-show without changing your RSVP, then you have likely taken a seat from someone else, made me very sad, and I put your name on the shit list. Don't do it. If you're running late I appreciate hearing from you.  Doors open at 6, and if you havent arrived or contacted me about running late by 6:30 I will begin offering seats to the waitlist.  I reserve the right to cancel the game if we can't get enough players.

-1 chip=call

-Verbally declared actions are binding

-No string bets or splashed pots

-Don't discuss hands as they are ongoing. Talking about hands or action is allowed only are when heads up, and only by the 2 players remaining in the pot.

-Hands must remain on table or not more than 12 inches from the edge of the table and must be visible to all players.

-Everyone makes mistakes but strive to pay attention so you act in turn in a timely fashion.

-Cut-off shuffles

WHERE: SAMURAI BOSTON 827 Boylston Steet

{the restaurant underneath Chili Duck)

If you are attending the Anime Boston 2016 convention on THURSDAY please join us for a "Meet and Greet" so that you can meet the other members of The Boston Japanese Films & Anime Social Group! We'll look over the schedule together,  and meet members who want to attend activities together during the convention!

Hope to see you there!

Amarley Garrison Quaye, Co-Organizer

Cell Phone Number[masked]

"Anime Boston is a three-day convention held annually in Boston, Massachusetts, USA under the supervision of the New England Anime Society. Our focus is to celebrate and promote Japanese animation, comics, and pop-culture.

This event has been a cornerstone of the North East Anime Convention circuit since our inaugural event in April, 2003. Following unprecedented growth, we quickly outgrew the space in the Boston Park Plaza Hotel and moved to the Hynes Convention Center in 2005. The Hynes Convention Center and Sheraton Boston have allowed us to grow in ways we could not have imagined since the idea was first conceived.

While the main focus on Anime Boston has always been Japanese animation and comics, we have expanded to include other aspects of Japanese pop-culture: J-Pop, J-Rock, and live-action Japanese media. We have also delved into Japanese history and traditional culture, thus encouraging people to develop a more well-rounded perspective.

Over 350 staff members work to make this convention possible. On top of that, everyone is a volunteer; no one gets paid for what they do. We all participate because we are also fans (and might be a little crazy). We work year-round to prepare for each convention; in fact, planning for the next year begins before the previous one is even over! Our staff is incredibly diverse and comes from all walks of life and experiences. The hard work and dedication of our staff members ensures that we put on the best show possible.

Of course, Anime Boston would not be the success it has become without the support of its members and fans. Starting with a staggering 4,000 members in 2003 (an incredible feat for a brand new convention), by 2012 we had expanded to welcome more than 22,000 people over the weekend. The majority of our panels are actually presented by members who just want to share their passions with the larger community. Having members organize some of the programming for Anime Boston gives everyone a sense of community and belonging at our event.

We, the staff of Anime Boston and the New England Anime Society, thank you for taking interest in our convention. Your excitement helps energize everyone and spreads the word to new people. We hope to see you there!"

results.description:
We're gettin' excited at the W3C! 


WoT? No Passwords, you say? Payments made safer and the Web more secure? The future is bright, and it's time for all of us to be reminded of that. 

So join us for a W3C Developer meetup at the US Host for the W3C: MIT. Event host Guillaume Baudusseau warmly welcomes you to join us for a series of short presentations on emerging technology and the future of the World Wide Web today!

We're serving it up family-style with a choice of great pizzas, provided by non-other than Jared Spool and the User Interface Engineering team. Our community has some great friends in the area, so you never know exactly who might drop by! 

A "Pub Casual" will continue for those interested in more personal discourse and W3C involvement across the way at the R&D Pub from 8:00 PM onward.


Cheers!

Guillaume
results.name: Let's move the Web forward together

The focus on value-driven healthcare has doctors, nurses, and caregivers looking for information outside the walls of a hospital or clinic. Unfortunately, the wearables, smart home and health device markets are still in their infancy and face numerous protocol, security, analytical and validation hurdles. In this panel discussion we will discuss the revolutionary impact the Internet of Things (IoT) will have on the healthcare industry today and into the future.

Sean Lorenz (moderator)

Sean Lorenz is Founder & CEO of Senter, a startup creating an IoT cognitive assistant for longer and healthier aging in place. Dr. Lorenz was recently the Director of IoT Market Strategy for LogMeIn’s IoT platform as well as cofounder of the TechStars robotics startup Neurala. He has shaped business models and product strategies in several emerging markets including IoT, robotics, artificial intelligence and healthcare. He holds a PhD in Cognitive & Neural Systems from Boston University and has extensive knowledge in digital health, natural language processing, brain-computer interfaces, adaptive systems, neuroscience-based computational algorithms, and context-aware computing.

Shahid Azim (panelist)

Shahid Azim is a serial entrepreneur having started multiple venture backed companies in health care and technology services . His most recent company Quanttus is based on technology developed at MIT and focused on building clinically relevant wearable technology combined with a preventive care services platform. To date the company has raised over $30M from silicon valleys top investors. Prior to this in 2009 he co-founded a company Lantos Technologies with Prof. Doug Hart at MIT to build the world's first 3D digital direct scanning of human ear canals to revolutionize the way people experience hearing aids and earphones. Built Lantos from an idea to an FDA cleared medical device that stands to impact over 9 million lives a year. Shahid holds Bachelors in Finance from SU, post graduate in management from Harvard University and an MBA from Sloan School of Management at MIT. He is deeply passionate about technology driven impact for healthcare and believes that we will all look back in a few years to be amazed at how little we really knew about our bodies in real time and the impact of our lifestyle choices on our ability to live long healthy lives.

Yogendra Jain (panelist)

Yogendra Jain is a serial entrepreneur with over 25 years of technical and management experience. He has done pioneering work in IoT in telehealth, medical electronics, telecommunications, and IA (Intelligent Assistant) with a multitude of technologies including hardware, firmware, manufacturing, software, applications, machine-machine, and user experience design. He was an EVP of telehealth and innovation at RxAdvance, a PBM (Pharmacy Benefit Management) company which acquired SentiCare, a company he founded. He developed the PillStation, a healthcare gateway (IoT), and disruptive telehealth services to improve adherence and member health leading to significant cost savings to healthcare organizations. Previously he was co-founder of Covectra, which offers medication ePedigree, serialization, and track-and-trace. Jain was founder and chief technology officer of ThinkEngine Networks, developing high density media gateways for internet voice navigation, a Siri and Echo like products. Prior to that, he was VP/GM of RadiSys Corporation, a public company, which acquired his first startup Sonitech, specializing in high speed computing in medical imaging and signal processing applications. Jain also holds two patents.

We would like to thank Mansfield Law for sponsoring this event. Meet movers & shakers and feel the passion.Make your shyness go away. (transition from lab to business world)

Take The  8 Steps That Will Change Your Life

The Original Steppers of Boston has earned two  Steppin' Instruction Certifications**.                            


Every Thursday

Classes - Practice - Open Dance

Beginners Welcome!!
Men, Women, Singles, Couples

Instructional Hours:

Beginners Class 6pm -7pm

Everyone Else Class 7pm-8pm


Open Dance & Practice 8pm - Until


The Original Steppers of Boston offer Certified Chicago Style Steppin' dance instruction for the new beginner to the seasoned stepper. We also host a supportive environment for steppers to practice and participate in an open dance to hone their dance skills.

We welcome you to stop by to get an idea of what Steppin' Chicago Style is all about. There is a $10 participation fee to get on the dance floor, first visit is FREE. A partner is encouraged, but not required.

Doors open at 6:00pm.

*** Please wear comfortable clothes and smooth bottom shoes (NO SNEAKERS, MARKING SOLES or RUBBER BOTTOMS)!  Gentlemen must remove their hats. Powder is not allowed on the dance floor***

Bring your Steppin' notebook
Courtesy Note:: Please be on time.
Practice outside of class is expected and necessary.

Class attendance may be a prerequisite for the Royce Banks Steppin' Is A Lifestyle Workshops.

**Certified Instruction provided by The Original Steppers of Boston Inc 2006 Team**

Full Bar!!  Free Parking!! Kitchen is Open!!

We ask that you patronize the bar and tip the staff for their services.

Next Level Business Forum; "expertise for innovation"

NEXT LEVEL BUSINESS FORUM brings together business-owners, -coaches, and -service-providers, for enlightened discussions. Each participant, expert in his own field, benefits from the others’ perspectives.

This WEEK Business owners will learn and gain insights from our experts!

See more details in the agenda below. 

--

GETTING HERE

Join us at Cambridge Innovation Center, 1 Broadway, Cambridge, 5th floor, Cozumel Room

• Register as a guest at the front desk and mention that you're attending our event on the 5th floor.

• Optionally: Meet us at Venture Cafe for networking before the event. Venture Cafe serves as a physical nexus for helping innovators and entrepreneurs find one another and collaborate to bring their dreams to reality.  All attendees to the Cafe should adhere to the Venture Cafe contributor model (http://vencaf.org/thursdaycafeboston/contributor-model/) and credo (http://vencaf.org/credo/). Learn more here: vencaf.org.

--

QUESTIONS? NEED HELP? 

- Contact: [masked], call or text:[masked]

- Look for the Gain Street sign 

AGENDA

6 pm -  Follow signs to the Cozumel Room on the 5th floor.

1. Intros

2. Bring your hardest problems and collaborate with other entrepreneurs and experts in a group setting

3. Owners and Experts break into groups for an idea sharing round

FREE PIZZA - Gain Street's Next Level Business Forum


Optional:


5 pm -  networking at Venture Cafe

*Venture Cafe is a club for innovators. Learn more here: vencaf.org


Need help getting here? Contact [masked], call or text: [masked]

. 


-- 

REQUESTS & FEEDBACK - [masked] 

Let us know what you want most from this group! We’d love to hear your ideas about how we can use our resources to help businesses get to the next level. 

--

GAIN STREET 

Have you heard about Gain Street?? 

...Gain Street is the best place to get help for your business. 

We're a funded startup at Cambridge Innovation Center, and we're building an app that's also a "business coach" 

Leveling up your “Gain Street Cred” improves your business in real life. 

On Gain Street you can 

- See how you stack up against other businesses like you

- Get help from coaches and experts where you need it most

- And discover opportunities to take your business to the next level

Learn more about us at 

www.GainStreet.co

results.description:
"Broadening our visual experiences and influences can enliven and stimulate our creativity and imagination. By exploring other visual art forms such as paintings and sculpture, and how these artists create by using color and visual design, we expand our own concept of experience and expression in our photographs. " Bruce w. Heinemann

Greetings Photographers!

We can discover a great deal about taking better pictures by looking at the paintings of accomplished artists. I visited the Guild of Boston Artists a few weeks ago for the first time. I discovered they have many talented artists who specialize in capturing the luminous effects we are often attempting to create in our photography. I immediately signed up to be on their mailing list and so I know they are having a special event  Thursday March 24th.

At this special reception several artists will be present to talk about the way they translate their experience of the landscape into a painting. They will briefly discuss topics such as composition, color, and light. And of course these are the same topics we are exploring week after week in our photography workshops.  

http://guildofbostonartists.org find out more about the guild. 

I hope you will come and engage with the artists, ask questions about their creative process, or just take time to look at their paintings and discover some new design elements you can include in you photography.

 It is a great evening, so come enjoy a glass of wine and ask the questions you have always wanted to ask. This is also a great opportunity to meet others in the group if you are new to our meet up so I hope you will come out and join us. 

Please RSVP here an then I will contact the gallery and let them know how many of us are attending so they can plan accordingly. 

Hope to see you there! 

Suzanne
results.how_to_find_us: we will be in the main gallery
results.name: free Photo Social: The Guild of Boston Artists Reception

His most recent company Quanttus is based on technology developed at MIT and  focused on building clinically relevant wearable technology combined with a preventive care services platform. To date the company has raised over $30M from silicon valleys top investors. Prior to this in 2009 he co-founded a company  Lantos Technologies with Prof. Doug Hart at MIT to build the world's first 3D digital direct scanning of human ear canals to revolutionize the way people experience hearing aids and earphones. Afik Gal (panelist)

Afik Gal is a physician, Duke MBA and an entrepreneur with 12 years of cross functional – technology, clinical and business experience in healthcare analytics and digital health. Afik is currently an SVP at eviCore healthcare after previously leading product and BizDev at QPIDHealth(acquired by eviCore). Prior to joining QPID, Afik led PWC’s healthcare innovation lab where he focused on business model innovation to marry technologies (e.g. digital health, advanced analytics, IoT, behavior change) with payers, providers and pharma needs. As an entrepreneur Afik founded a boutique consulting firm which helped hospitals and tech vendors design and implement new technologies into their lines of products. Among his clients were Amdocs, SAP,Orbotech, NetApp and other leading technology companies. Afik also founded a medical analytics startup that built a consumer facing self-diagnosis system shortening e-visits. Afik advises multiple digital health and healthcare analytics companies.

Chris Smith (panelist)

Chris Smith focuses on IoT related technologies and their application in the healthcare industry. He has held various strategy, product marketing, general management and product management roles, in both leadership and hands-on capacities in healthcare and other industries.Currently as director of product marketing at Imprivata, Inc., Chris is responsible for several key product marketing initiatives at this dynamic, fast paced innovative healthcare IT security company, which leverages IoT related technologies in its solutions. He has launched innovative high profile products, established go-to-market, sales enablement and demand generation strategies, and held key roles integrating an acquisition.His previous work experience includes 9 years at Gartner. Prior to joining Gartner, Chris worked with Phillips Medical to commercialize an innovative mobile product and service offering for the healthcare industry. Chris holds an MBA from the University of Chicago and an undergraduate degree in Electrical Engineering from the University of Liverpool in the UK. He lives with his family in Newton. Chris is helping organized the healthcare track for the MIT Enterprise Forums, Connected Things 2016 conference on April 5th at the MIT Media Lab.

Yogendra Jain (panelist)

 Yogendra Jain is a serial entrepreneur with over 25 years of technical and management experience. He has done pioneering work in IoT  in telehealth, medical electronics, telecommunications, and IA (Intelligent Assistant) with a multitude of technologies including hardware, firmware, manufacturing, software, applications, machine-machine, and user experience design. He was an EVP of telehealth and innovation at RxAdvance, a PBM (Pharmacy Benefit Management) company which acquired SentiCare, a company he founded. He developed the PillStation, a healthcare gateway (IoT), and disruptive telehealth services to improve adherence and member health leading to significant cost savings to healthcare organizations. Previously he was co-founder of Covectra, which offers medication ePedigree, serialization, and track-and-trace. Jain was founder and chief technology officer of ThinkEngine Networks, developing high density media gateways for internet voice navigation, a Siri and Echo like products. Prior to that, he was VP/GM of RadiSys Corporation, a public company, which acquired his first startup Sonitech, specializing in high speed computing in medical imaging and signal processing applications. Jain also holds two patents.

Paul Floyd (panelist)

Paul has a broad background as an operating executive in high-tech including healthcare IT, telecommunications, data networking, internet, eCommerce, IT Devices and Services, and software. He has been responsible for the introduction of market leading products and services while in senior positions at AT&T Bell Labs, Paradyne Networks, iBasis, TimeLinx Software, and Senscio Systems.  As COO at iBasis, a pioneering and entrepreneurial global internet VoIP technology startup, Paul was instrumental in driving the growth over a 10 year period to $1.2 billion in revenue that led to a successful exit with the sale of iBasis to KPN in the Netherlands in 2011.  Paul is currently COO / CFO at Senscio Systems, a healthcare technology company that developed Ibis™, a unique behavior-based solution to patient centric chronic care management. Ibis creates a clinical safety net for persons with complex social, clinical, and behavioral conditions and the people who care for them. Through a constant and extensive application of artificial intelligence, Ibis recognizes emerging health issues in real time and notifies the appropriate members of the care team. This results in improved adherence and timely actions to prevent exacerbations that often lead to unnecessary hospitalizations.

We would like to thank Mansfield Law for sponsoring this event. 

Volunteer With Us  

Improve your personal or business brand in the Boston health innovation community?Build extensive and deep relationships with the decision makers in the local healthcare community.Convert your startup dream into action.Learn a lot of information about Digital health, marketing and general entrepreneurship in a compressed period of time.Meet unique people with global perspectives.Make an impact.Belong to a community. Meet movers & shakers and feel the passion.Make your shyness go away. (transition from lab to business world)

Let's chat, shoot us an email - [masked] or just give us a call at 617.651.1457.

results.description:
This year I’m starting something a little new. Mindful eating is about eating with awareness. Awareness helps people to have a better sense of when they are hungry and when they are full, when they overeat, what cues them to overeat, and what types of situations or environmental factors make overeating more likely to happen. Mindfully eating is typically thought of as slowing down, tasting one’s food, pacing oneself and being able to appreciate food more. However, this is simply is not enough instruction for people who want more of a conscious approach to changing unhelpful eating habits. 

Recently I found the book Eating the Moment by Pavel Somov, Ph.D. This book offers 141 exercises to eat mindfully. They are clever, helpful, and experiential options to increase one’s awareness of eating. The mindful eating groups that I will be co-hosting will be based on these 141 exercises. My goal is to get through the entire book, but to find people who are interested in doing it with me. If you are interested in this journey, you must get the book. Every time we meet for dinner there will be 2-3 exercises to try during the week, and we will report on how they went for each of us. 

For this MeetUp I am asking people to read through the first part of Chapter 2, Becoming Mindful of the Process of Eating. In the paper copy, this starts on page 73. We will be focusing on The Four Aspects of Taste as well as the Subtext of Texture, and using ideas from this book to describe, taste, and categorize our food as we eat. Remember that this is a group where participation is part of the process and there is no experiential learning if there is no experimenting/ doing/ trying. 


Please remember to bring a copy of your book to the group. 

Mindful Eating Meetups will be cohosted with other meetup groups, and will include locations on the North Shore as well as in and around Boston. We will try to meet consistently as there is more interest. That is also why the attendance may seem small or limited; because we are accommodating another group. As an FYI, this event will be mixed gender and may include men.  In addition, here is an exercise that I would like participants to consider, in the overarching theme of awareness of ethnic diversity and food:

1)  Research the country of the ethnic food MeetUp group and make a list of current facts about the country. Consider facts that you find interesting or fascinating and share your facts with the group.

2)  Find a food or spice that the restaurant uses in its dishes and research any health benefits, uses for the food, or other interesting facts about the food. Introduce the food to the group. Share the unique aspects of this food/ spice and/ or recipe with the group. 

As always, I will document people who NO SHOW as a NO SHOW and move towards not letting you attend future events. So if you make a commitment, come.

results.description:
Register today at http://bit.ly/160324Mtup

Meet the authors of "Design Sprint," one of the hottest new books about digital product design. C. Todd Lombardo is an outstanding product thought leader who was the keynote speaker at last year's Product Camp. Richard Branfield is CEO and co-founder of Fresh Tilled Soil and has a broad, global background in product and marketing. 

Published in late 2015, "Design Sprint" has gotten great reviews and provides a practical how-to guide to rapidly prototyping and testing product ideas - within a week! 

 C. Todd and Richard will provide an introduction to the design sprint process, focusing on the first phase of a design sprint: Understand. This short talk will be all about understanding the elements of a design sprint: how and why they work, in what situations they are useful, how to implement them in your organization, and what happens after you've completed one. 

We will have a limited number of books available for sale.  Or you can bring your copy of "Design Sprint" to get it signed by the authors. Don't have a copy? Then, register in advance to be entered in a drawing to receive one of six signed copies of "Design Sprint."

IMPORTANT: There is a fee for this event.  Please register in advance on the following page to receive the discounted advance price of $20 or no charge for BPMA premium members: </a><a href="http://bit.ly/160218Meet1">http://bit.ly/160324Mtup 

Registration opens at 6:15 pm

ABOUT THE SPEAKERS


C. Todd Lombardo, Chief Design Strategist at Fresh Tilled Soil

C. Todd Lombardo is a leader who wears many hats, all at once: author, designer, scientist, professor, and visualizer. After originally beginning his career in science, C. Todd shifted his focus to product and design, ultimately innovating, designing, and managing products for countless companies large and small. In his role as Chief Design Strategist at Fresh Tilled Soil, he employs strategic thinking to craft smart, impactful solutions that radically transform clients’ product strategies. C. Todd serves as Adjunct Faculty at IE Business School in Madrid, and co-authored the book "Design Sprint," published by O'Reilly.

Richard Banfield, CEO and co-founder of Fresh Tilled Soil

After completing a degree in Biology, Richard was attracted to the world of web technologies and worked his way up the digital food chain, starting with online ad sales at MultiChoice, Africa’s largest TV and Internet media business. He was in the thick of it during the dot-com years, co-founding Acceleration, an international advertising technology business headquartered in London (now owned by advertising giant WPP). 

Richard has delivered product design, high-level business strategy, global marketing campaigns, and workshops to clients in the US, UK, Europe, and Africa. His colorful life experience includes being an officer in the army and being a dive master on the remote Islamic Republic of the Comoros, where he learned the survival skills he uses daily in the fast paced tech world. Richard is a mentor at several incubators and accelerators as well as Advisor and lecturer at the Startup Institute. 

Richard recently published two books. Design Leadership is his second book published by O’Reilly. The first was Design Sprint: A Practical Guidebook for Building Great Digital Products, which he coauthored with CTodd Lombardo and Trace Wax.


EVENT SPONSOR

Special thanks to event sponsor District Hall.

results.description:
Are you Separated or Divorced, Considering Divorce, Or Currently in the Process of Divorce? Please join us for March's Divorce Basics Monthly Series: Divorce & Taxes. Shelia May, Masters of Taxation and CPA, will lead this month's timely and important event.


There is no cost for attendance. Complimentary refreshments and snacks will be provided. This is a multi-group event listed on other meetups, so attendance will be greater than the RSVP's on this meetup alone.

This event is intended to be partly informational, partly social, and totally empowering. Attendance to this event and information shared will be kept confidential.

Topic: Whether or not your spouse is reporting financial information accurately is often the main concern in the divorce process. Also, filing taxes in this situation and determining the consequences of settlement proposals can be confusing. Sheila will provide a handout of financial considerations for before, during and after the divorce process. She will discuss filing taxes during and after divorce, as well as hidden income.

This event is casual/interactive and not formal, which is a setting that prior attendees have really liked. We sit in a circle and the attendees have the opportunity to ask questions in the group setting, as well as ask the professionals questions one on one during the mix and mingle time towards the end. At this event, there will also be divorce attorney and mediator, David Kellem, and financial advisors, Bob Vona and Samantha Steer, to answer your questions.

When: Thursday March 24th 6:30 – 8:30 p.m. & Saturday March 26th 12 – 2 p.m. Both dates are the same event (Meetups listed separately). Choose the time convenient for you.

Similar Divorce Basics events at this location will be held every month on the fourth Thursday and fourth Saturday. Please check the calendar for these upcoming events:

•Thursday, April 28 & Saturday, April 30, 2016 (5th Saturday this month); Divorce Basics: How to approach dating again and in the online context – set up a profile and manage responses. With Susan D. Trotter, PhD

• Thursday, May 19 & Saturday, May 21, 2016 (3rd Thursday & Saturday this month, because of Memorial Day); Divorce Basics -- A Legal Overview of the Divorce Process. With David Kellem, Divorce Attorney and Mediator

• Thursday, June 23 & Saturday, June 25, 2016; Divorce Basics: The House -- Should you try to keep it or sell it; what to consider

results.description:
PostGIS is an extension that adds geospatial features and processing to the popular, open-source database PostgreSQL. 


Following up on this month's Maptime tutorial on PostGIS, we take a deeper look at how to use OpenStreetMap data with PostGIS as well as when and why you would want to do so.

Among other things, we will try different data formats and tools for importing OSM data into PostGIS, look at when to use which of the different available schemas, as well as tips and pitfalls when working specifically with data from OpenStreetMap.

We will also look at basic geospatial operations, and a


quick overview of how to use common tools such as QGIS, Mapnik and Tilemill to query OSM data in PostGIS.

As always, this is a hands-on meetup, so we encourage you to install PostgreSQL and PostGIS beforehand and bring your laptop:

PostgreSQL:
http://www.postgresql.org/download/

PostGIS installation:
http://www.postgis.us/presentations/postgis_install_guide_22.html
results.how_to_find_us: Ring #1 doorbell and we'll come and open. Note: This is the Kingston Street near Downtown Crossing, zip 02111.
results.name: Using OSM data with PostGIS

results.description:
A World Underwater: The Reefs of Belize 

Meet in the MOS lobby at 6:30, pick up your eventbrite ticket at the table. Drinks and discussion continues at Dante next door after the event.

Eventbrite sold out fast. If you want to try for standby, show up early and add your name to the list to get no-show tickets 

http://world-underwater.eventbrite.com/ 

Take an underwater journey to Glover's Reef Research Station in Belize and immerse yourself in coral reefs! 

With images and cutting-edge immersive video captured during their January 2016 expedition, Keith Ellenbogen and Allan Adams will tell the story of the Mesoamerican reef ecosystem, the researchers working hard to conserve it, and the innovative MIT course behind the expedition in which students from across the institute (chemists, civil engineers, historians, physicists, and poets) learned the art, technique, and technology of underwater conservation photography.


Under the Planetarium's full-dome expanse, experience the thrills, challenges, and serendipity of wildlife photography and explore the role of visual culture as a catalyst for positive social change on our tiny blue planet.

Advance registration begins at 9:00 am, Thursday, March 10 (Tuesday, March 8 for Museum members).

In Partnership with MIT.

Photo © Keith Ellenbogen

About the Speakers

Keith Ellenbogen, award-winning underwater photographer and 2015 – 16 CAST Visiting Artist at MIT | Allan Adams, PhD, theoretical physicist, associate professor of physics and member of the Creative Art Council at MIT
results.name: The Reefs of Belize - Free in the Planetarium (eventbrite sold out, fly standby)

results.description:
Join us at Sunset Tap and Grill on Thursday 3/24 to celebrate the debut of Stony Creek Brewery in Massachusetts! With 8 great beers on taps that have never been sold in MA before you won'y want to miss this party! 

RSVP with the website it is free

 https://www.eventbrite.com/e/stony-creek-debut-party-barrel-aged-cinnamon-chocolate-porter-black-wheat-wine-more-tickets-22663619496?utm_campaign=order_confirmation_email&utm_medium=email&ref=eemailordconf&utm_source=eb_email&utm_term=eventname

Sip on the Chahklit Baltic Porter - a tribute to Jamaican Chahklit tea - this beer is brewed with almonds, earthy Ceylon Cinnamon and cacao nibs and then aged in Caribbean rum barrels. The Reposado Negro is a Black Wheat Wine that has been aged in Tequila barrels. Roasted malt "charred" flavors mix beautifully with a sweetness from the tequila barrels. At 9.5% this one is boozy! Sun Juice is a tasty Belgian Summer Ale that's brewed with wheat and Saison yeast. It's also got a bit of orange peel, grapefruit peel, coriander and chamomile, reminding you that summer is coming!The Stony Joe is a unique blend of styles. A golden mocha stout, it is Brewed like a milk stout but instead of dark malts they use English barley giving it a golden color. Throw in some cocoa nibs and roasted coffee and you have yourself a fantastic brew! 

With so many awesome beers to try you're gonna want to get their early (and maybe get a flight or two). So RSVP and we'll see you there! 

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbeerimages.pintley.com%2F47952%2Fsunjuice_web.png&sig=ADR2i7-TrsOUo3tsCByrgeVeix7IRfCugQ

Sun Juice

Saison - 5.3%

Sun Juice is a refreshing Belgian Summer Ale brewed with wheat. Saison yeast produces a silky body while orange peel, grapefruit peel, corriander , and chamomile impart a spicy and fruity complexity. It's summertime, grab youirself some Sun Juice.

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbeerimages.pintley.com%2F47949%2Fstony%2520creek_web.png&sig=ADR2i7_uuDvrcVzaJKJudzy5qYx05d6nag

Chahklit Baltic Porter

Baltic Porter - 8.5%

Grandma Clara makes Chahklit Tea for her family. She uses hand ground cacao pods, cinnamon leaf, almond, milk, and maybe the occasionaL splash of rum...for your health. This is our tribute to her Jamaican tradition. Chahklit is a Baltic Porter brewed with almonds and earthy Ceylon Cinnamon. Cacao Nibs impart rich chocolate depth. IT ages in Caribbean Rum Barrels to lend oak complexity and subtle Rum nuance. Sip it slowly and be transported back to Grandma Clara's kitchen.

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbeerimages.pintley.com%2F47950%2Frespoda_web.png&sig=ADR2i79kcvkQEBebP2sIoYF-m8Ixjy90-g

Reposado Negro

American Barleywine - 9.2%

Reposado Tequila is known for its oak aged, smooth complexity. This is our interpretation of the fine Mexican spirit. Reposado Negro is A Black Wheat Wine aged in Tequila Barrels. A marriage of sweet alcohol warmth, smooth bready texture, and roasted malt "charred" flavors, this jet black brew will have you swearing you are sipping a top shelf tequila.

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbeerimages.pintley.com%2F47951%2Fbigcranky_web.png&sig=ADR2i7_bwfc0SZfxh7JXNQ0D7TnG4CjVyw

Big Cranky Double IPA

Imperial IPA - 9.5%

A Bold West Coast Double IPA, this is the crankiest of our IPAs. 7 different hops contribute complex and juicy hop character. Its dry finish allows the hops to stand out. At 9.5% ABV and 95 IBUs, while remarkably cranky, this beer is extraordinarily drinkable.

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbeerimages.pintley.com%2F47955%2Fstony%2520creek_web.png&sig=ADR2i7-_06pstpzvVYIxB8dIQxs6McvRYg

Petite Cranky

India Pale Ale (IPA)

This is an anniversary beer by stony creek. A session IPA with Saison yeast!

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbeerimages.pintley.com%2F47954%2Fstonyjoe_web.png&sig=ADR2i7-cCPNFPhO8u0qLqJc9fWNsf9oaiQ

Stony Joe

Stout - 5.5%

Stony Joe is a Golden Mocha Stout. It is designed like a traditional Milk Stout but without using the typical roasted dark malts. Instead we use a boat load of rich, decadent golden colored English barley, flaked barley, flaked oats, and flaked wheat to give it lush body and smooth sweetness. We then ferment it on Cocoa Nibs and add fresh locally roasted Guatemalan Coffee, directly to the fermenter. The cocoa nibs and coffee add the rich mocha notes and bright roasty/coffee aroma!

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbeerimages.pintley.com%2F46413%2Fsnowhole_web.png&sig=ADR2i7-1GztxDmM1c87pJWEWCJ_DCjMgpw

Snow Hole Imperial Red

Imperial IPA - 8.5% 85 IBUs

A Snowhole is someone who loves a brutal winter. Our Double Red, with its malty notes of caramel and dark sugar, is complemented perfectly by intense citrus and spicy hops. 6 different hops, 8 hop additions, over 3.5 pounds of hops per barrel, 8.5% ABV and 85 IBUs make for a winter brew that can stand up to any storm.

results.description:
Come and join Green Cambridge for our monthly Thursday meet-up! NOTE THE DATE CHANGE!!


Our President, Quinton Zondervan, will be discussing his experience attending COP21 in Paris. He will then be leading a lively discussion on how to bring the international agreement here to Cambridge. 

We will also be serving free wine and beer!!

We are a group of Cantabrigians dedicated to improving the environment and striving for sustainability. We'll be talking about all things green, giving run-downs on our community, advocacy and organizing work, and just getting to know one another.

Can't make it? We'll be repeating the event the third Thursday of every month! Plus, our organizing and planning meetings happen the first Thursday of every month. Also check us out on Facebook, Twitter, and at <a>www.greencambridge.org.</a>
results.how_to_find_us: Look for our banner!
results.name: Thursday Socials with Green Cambridge!

Attend a screening of SEMBENE! Director Samba Gadjigo will attend in person for Q&A. Afterwards, we'll grab drinks nearby. Tickets are free that evening, first-come, first serve. http://thedocyard.com/2016/01/sembene/
results.name: SEMBENE! Thursday 3/24 at 7pm

results.description:
Crossroads Irish Pub (Boston,  Beacon St and Mass Ave intersection) 7 pm to 10 pm

Due to requests and great turnout, Japanese Evening Table is going back to Crossroads! Grab a few drinks and some delicious cheap bar food. Whether you're learning Japanese or English, buy a drink, join the table, and practice your new language in a friendly and relaxed environment. If you're a beginner or just interested in culture, you'll fit in fine! Don't miss out on this opportunity to learn and practice over a few drinks. Can't make it on time? Need to leave early? Not a problem. Just stop by if you can!

If you are >21 and plan to drink, please bring a MA state issued ID or passport. Other state IDs may not be accepted. Please order at the bar and take care of your own tab.

Transportation: I highly recommend using public transportation. Not only is driving while intoxicated dangerous, but there may not be any parking available in the area. A lot of the parking in the area is Residential Only in the evenings, and many of the signs indicating this are very well hidden. Also, watch out for those hidden street cleaning signs! If you insist on parking in the area, be aware that meter maids love handing out parking tickets around here. Best methods for public transportation are the green line subway to Hynes or bus #1 to stop between Beacon and Marlborough.

Ordering at Crossroads: 

1) Order all your drinks and food at the bar. 

2) Start a tab (付け) or pay as you go. Don't forget to tip. 

See you there!
~Lindsay
results.how_to_find_us: Probably on the first floor, but look for the sign!
results.name: Backbay Japanese Evening Table

results.description:
This is a 4 week course. If you RSVP for this date you are RSVPing for the complete 4 week course. Please only RSVP if you are committed to attending to the whole series.


This course introduces students to the basic principles of 3D modeling, such as how to navigate in 3D space, what 3D models are made out of, and how to create simple forms and objects. The software used will be Sketchup, a free program that is excellent for beginners and professionals alike. Students will learn the ins and outs of the program, from basic techniques to advanced modeling concepts. This series is for people who have not already taken a 3D modeling class at HATCH.


Requirements:


• A free copy of Sketchup. 

• A CAD-capable laptop or desktop. The computer must have a discrete graphics chip or a very new (last three years) onboard graphics chip.


• A three button (minimum) mouse.


• You must be an experienced Windows or Mac user.


• You should be able to utilize keyboard shortcuts and understand how to use computer file systems.


*If you need a laptop please contact the organizer, we have six laptops available for use. We prefer that you use your own for this class.*

If you are bringing your own computer, please pre-load Sketchup Make. You can download it from www.sketchup.com.
results.how_to_find_us: We're located in the Arsenal Project (formerly Arsenal Mall). Park in the lot near Old Navy entrance, you'll see a big yellow-green sign over the doors. HATCH is between Pearle Vision and Game Stop.
results.name: Introduction to 3D Modeling (4 week class)

results.name: THE TATTOO SHOOT

results.description:
We'll run routes along the Charles River Greenway, Riverwalk, Newton and neighborhoods of Waltham, with options to extend for those who are looking to add distance (or end early!) Afterward we'll hop into the bar for post-run drinks. 

We meet in front of Shoppers Cafe and leave at 7:00p. There should be plenty of parking on the street and in the neighborhood. All levels are welcome, with a broad range of paces!

Runs are typically 3-5 miles. 

As our daylight becomes more limited, it is highly recommended to at least wear bright clothing, and also to consider bringing a reflective vest and/or lamp.  


See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: In front of Shoppers Cafe
results.name: Thursday Night Run for Thirsty Runners (3-6 Miles, All Levels!)

results.description:
"A universal theology is impossible, but a universal experience is not only possible but necessary. It is this experience toward which the course is directed." (ACIM Manual for Teachers)

Designed to correct perception and lead to a universal experience of knowledge, A Course In Miracles has been translated into 23 languages, is referenced and utilized by many of today's most reknowned spiritual teachers, and has inspired countless books and curriculums based on its teachings. But it can be a difficult book to grasp. It is lengthy, the writing is abstract, and its use of Christian terminology alienates many.

And yet it has become one of the most influential spiritual books of today. Join us as we dive into it, and are led to understand its principles against the backdrop of our own questions, personal experiences, and realizations. Beginner as well as advanced Course students are welcome. We'll start with a short meditation, and then use a reading from the Course as an entry point into our time together. Cost $5 per person.

Bringing a copy of the book is helpful, but not necessary. Recommended (but again not necessary) is the combined volume that includes the three supplements (Clarification of Terms; Psychotherapy: Purpose, Process, and Practice; The Song of Prayer), available online from The Foundation For Inner Peace at acim.org.
results.how_to_find_us: From Concord St.: we're 4/10th's of a mile down Russell St. on the right, the driveway after Fraser Farm.
results.name: Join us as we discuss A Course In Miracles and apply its principles to our lives

group.name: A Course In Miracles Discussion Group - Carlisle

results.description:
This group meets every Thursday at 7:00 pm. for an hour and 15 minutes of meditation and mutual support. If your looking for someone to do something to you, or for you, keep looking ! If your willing to show up and work on yourself ,with kindness and patience, that's what we're doing together here. We are like geese flying together ,each one "drafting" off the others , and supporting the others at the same time. The average attendance for this group is probably 4 or 5 people, even though most don't RSVP on meetup, so don't be afraid that you will be the only one there if you don't see other RSVPs.(Is that a word?)

  Thank you for your kind attention, Randy
results.name: Join us for a guided meditation followed by discussion ,reflection and questions

group.name: Meditation group at Breathewellness, Cook Lane,  Marlborough

results.description:
Thursday night figure drawing has an emphasis on one long pose, giving time for more involved approaches.  Painters and drawers welcome to this informal and supportive group, meeting in Damon's painting studio.


A few warm up quick poses will be followed by a long (2.5 hour) pose, with breaks for the model.

Members pay $10 as on Monday night, non-member drop-in is $25.  Membership fee for each month of $25 brings discounts on drawing and painting sessions and classes.  Pay membership fee online (see left-hand column) via paypal or credit card, or in person with cash or check.  First session of the month would therefore be $35 ($25 membership fee plus $10 session fee) and each session thereafter would be $10. 

Thanks!
results.how_to_find_us: corner of Central Street and Vernon Street, big brick building.  Park on Vernon street in front of building or in lot behind building.
results.name: Long Pose Drawing and Painting Session

results.description:
Join us for NEW Thursday Bouldering at Central Rock Gym Cambridge!

Everyone and all levels are welcome. Come and enjoy bouldering, getting to know fellow bouldering people and have lots of fun.

We can meet up at the right side of the hall where push-up bars are. We will get to know each other and start bouldering. I will send out the messages what I am wearing one or two days before. If you can't find me, talk to one of CRG people.

For those of you who never climbed or bouldered before, no worries. You can rent shoes from the gym. More information is below.

Price
Day pass : $22
Shoes rental : $5
Chalk rental : $2
more details : https://www.centralrockgym.com/cambridge_rates.php
results.name: Bouldering at Central Rock Cambridge

results.description: Come check out dragon boating with Living Root! We're a co-ed dragon boat team and we're always looking for new paddlers to join us. This is a great way to get in shape, stay in shape, meet people, and do something fun and competitive. How to get there: We practice at the pool at the JFK Elementary School in Somerville. Walk through the outdoor basketball courts to the rear of the building to find the pool entrance. Take the stairs down to the ground floor and head through the locker rooms to get to the pool. Practice will begin poolside at 7 pm. Wear athletic clothing. Although we won't do any swimming, you will get somewhat wet. Parking is free in the school parking lot. The T station at Porter Square is a 5 minute walk away. Practice will last an hour and 45 minutes. We provide paddles and all the necessary equipment--just bring yourself! No paddling experience is required. We have an excellent coaching staff who will teach you everything you will need to know. We often head out for a quick bite to eat after practice, and you're welcome to join us. Send questions to: Dave Parker at [masked] [url=http://www.livingroot.org/]www.livingroot.org[/url]
results.how_to_find_us: We meet by the pool.
results.name: Indoor Paddling Session

results.description:
We're doing something a bit different with this one!

For the first two meetings, we're primarily going to read the text:

1-12 (or so) and then 13-21.  We'll spend any remaining time sharing observations.

After that, we'll dig into John 1 and work our way through this markedly different (hmmm...or "John"-edly different?) telling of the Gospel of Jesus Christ.  

Spend an hour with others learning more about God's word!
results.name: Read John!

results.description: This is a songwriting environment where we critique each other's songs and offer constructive feedback.  This is NOT a performance meet-up. Please keep in mind this is a group for people who take songwriting seriously whether it is a hobby or a profession for you.  Please bring at least 5 copies of your song or songs.  There will be a keyboard available to perform your song, if you need it. If your song is on some sort of media device there will be a small pair of speakers as well.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the Circulation Room on the second floor
results.name: South Shore Songwriter's Group

results.description:
• Join us at Sunset Tap and Grill on Thursday 3/24 to celebrate the debut of Stony Creek Brewery in Massachusetts! With 8 great beers on taps that have never been sold in MA before you won'y want to miss this party! http://stonycreeksunset.eventbrite.com/?aff=mu

• Sip on the Chahklit Baltic Porter - a tribute to Jamaican Chahklit tea - this beer is brewed with almonds, earthy Ceylon Cinnamon and cacao nibs and then aged in Caribbean rum barrels. 

•   The Reposado Negro is a Black Wheat Wine that has been aged in Tequila barrels. Roasted malt "charred" flavors mix beautifully with a sweetness from the tequila barrels. At 9.5% this one is boozy! 

•   Sun Juice is a tasty Belgian Summer Ale that's brewed with wheat and Saison yeast. It's also got a bit of orange peel, grapefruit peel, coriander and chamomile, reminding you that summer is coming! 

• The Stony Joe is a unique blend of styles. A golden mocha stout, it is Brewed like a milk stout but instead of dark malts they use English barley giving it a golden color. Throw in some cocoa nibs and roasted coffee and you have yourself a fantastic brew! 

 With so many awesome beers to try you're gonna want to get their early (and maybe get a flight or two). So RSVP and we'll see you there!
results.name: Stony Creek Debut Party! Barrel-Aged Cinnamon Chocolate Porter; Black Wheat Wine

venue.name: Jon Fischer Photography - exact address given after you purchase your ticket

results.description:
Click here to purchase a ticket. Some $10 Tickets available for men. 

A guy's testimonial:

"Jon's singles events are relaxed, stimulating and they work!  Last one I went to had 15 women, all different than the ones who were at his previous month’s event.  I liked 3 women, they liked me, our contact info was exchanged by a third party, and they all want to get together!  That’s a successful evening.  Thank you Jon! "  

RSVP does not reserve a spot. Check out the (almost no risk) refund policy. 

This will be a fun evening of getting to know a whole bunch of eligible people in one night. There will be many opportunities to interact and connect and get to know each other and just have a good time. 

This will also just be a fun social gathering. Plenty of time just to hang out and connect. 

Wine and appetizers will be provided. 

Facilitated by Katie Greenman, M.A. founder of HumanSide and The Social Beings Project.Katie has a masters in Human Development, is a Certified Coach, Comedy School Graduate and founder of HumanSide (a value-driven consulting firm that designs and delivers experiential programs

A prepaid ticket is required in order to monitor gender-balance There will be no ticket sales at the door.

Jon

More Testimonials!!

Click here for An Audio Testimonial ---

Thank you to you and Katie for a warm & entertaining event! It was a fun evening and fostered personal growth and new connections. Looking forward to future events.-Aimee P

Wow. That was *fantastic*. The activities (and the wine) made meeting lots of interesting people really easy and a huge amount of fun. And the loft gallery location was perfect. I would definitely do it again. Thanks Jon, Katie and Abby!- Matt

I had a great time John and Katie were excellent host's. It was fun and a learning curve for me. There were a lot of great Singles there. The nicest thing was you never felt uncomfortable with anyone. I would recommend this to anyone jumping back into the dating scene. - Howard

That was a wonderful evening - fun, engaging. Definitely a success. Much more interaction than a typical speed dating event. Katie and Jon - nice job combining interesting activities, a great space and tasty food -Karen

results.description:
This is the only time this class will be offered this year

Accelerate your personal and spiritual transformation by receiving the Lightarian Rays.  A series of powerful, guided meditation attunements inspired by the Celestial Masters, Maitreya, El Morya, Buddha, Sananda, St. Germain, as well as our Universal Source!

The 1st five Rays focus on the essential phases of spiritual processing: Empowerment, Clearing, Healing, Activation, and Manifestation.

The 6th Ray, Source Ray - focuses on lifting you further into the unfolding global human ascension process.

The Lightarian Perspective:

Self-empowerment is the starting point for the spiritual awakening process ©  Then, the clearer you become, the more effectively you can heal ©  The more you clear and heal, then the greater can be your rate of personal energetic activations ©  All leading to a greater ability for you to manifest a higher level of Light in your day-to-day life!

Empowerment Ray

The starting point for the spiritual awakening process and serves as the pre-requisite for receiving the other Rays.  The Empowerment Ray stimulates a dramatic “spiritual wake-up call” of the highest order, triggering waves of energetic acceleration and vibrational changes.

Clearing Ray

Launches a gentle, effective “etheric deep cleaning” stripping away all of your adverse soul programming, inappropriate belief structures, and undesired mental and emotional patterns.

Healing Ray

Initiates a powerful process of holistic self-healing, returning you to a state of balance and alignment.

Activation Ray

Energetically activates your latent etheric coding and triggers powerful, ongoing spiritual initiations – allowing more of your Higher Self energies to flow into your day to day life.

Manifestation Ray

Expands your capacity for manifesting on all levels, opening you to attract spiritual, mental, emotional, and physical abundance…all to serve your highest process!

Source Ray

A connection with the energies of our Universal Source.  This Ray creates a dramatic leap to a new vibrational connection with even higher levels of divine energies. The first five Ray’s are a pre-requisite for receiving the Source Ray. 

If paid at each class          Total $445

If paid all at once before or at first class $350

Students will be registered with the Lightarian Institute and can begin transmitting attunements immediately!

Registration required contact Elaine at[masked] or [masked]
results.name: Lightarian Activation Ray Teachers Training Class(CLASS FULL)

results.description:
Monthly Happy our with our friends at Porter Square.

Conveniently located in Porter Square in Cambridge, we're just minutes from the Red Line T station. We play Top 40 hits weekend nights and have all the major sporting events on - yes we have all the major broadcasting networks! We have 17 TVs total in the restaurant and 2 big projectors, so everyone has view of the game.Tavern is the best local spot featuring a wide variety of menu options, great beer selection with 50 beers on draft and seasonal craft cocktails, and the greatest staff in the square. We're able to host larger parties, and you don't have to worry about catering to different tastes because we have something for everyone!

results.description:
This meeting will be our regular meeting PLUS Beginner's Night!

Though we welcome beginners (and players of all strengths) to all our meetings, at Beginner's Night we place a special emphasis on welcoming newbies to the game we all love. We will have additional boards (large and small) as well as several players on hand to give basic lessons and teaching games. Milan Mladenovic is the coordinator for Beginner's Night, and if you have any questions you can reach him at milan.mladenovic.ja[at]gmail.com, as well as Andrew Hall, either here on Meetup or via email at hndrewaall[at]gmail.com.

results.description:
Kurukulla Center is once again delighted to have Venerable Amy Miller Visit our Center for teachings this coming March

Venerable Amy will be arriving on Friday, March 18, and will depart on Friday, March 26. Her teaching schedule is as follows:

Saturday, March 19, 10:00 am to 5:00 pm:

Awakening Mindfulness: The Importance of Meditation and How to Practice Calm Abiding (Shiné)

Sunday, March 20, 1:00 to 5:00 pm:

Get Real: The Wisdom Realizing Emptiness and How It Creates a Happier, More Peaceful Life

Tuesday, March 22, 7:00 to 9:00 pm:

The Truth about Tantra: Breaking through the Myth and Understanding Initiations, Sadhanas, and How it Shortcuts Our Path to Enlightenment

Thursday, March 24, 7:00 to 9:00 pm:

Transforming Anger and Depression

Detailed information regarding each of these classes will shortly be published in our Calendar

About Venerable Amy:

Venerable Amy J. Miller (Ven. Lobsang Chodren) was ordained as a Buddhist nun in June 2000 by the great Tibetan master, Ven. Choden Rinpoche, and has been teaching extensively since 1992. She first encountered Tibetan Buddhism in the spring of 1987 during a course at Kopan Monastery in Nepal. Since then, she has spent a great deal of time engaged in meditation retreats, study, teaching, and Buddhist center management throughout the world.

Her teaching style emphasizes a practical approach to integrating Buddhist philosophy into everyday life. She is happy to help people connect with meditation and mindfulness in an effort to gain a refreshing perspective on normally stressful living. Amy’s courses and retreats focus on establishing and maintaining a meditation and mindfulness practice, death and dying, overcoming anxiety and depression, battling addiction, dealing with self-esteem issues, and cultivating compassion and loving kindness. She is also often involved in leading a variety of retreats.

Amy is the co-author of Buddhism in a Nutshell - and a contributor to Living in the Path, a series of on-line courses produced by FPMT. Based in the United States, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, Amy teaches and leads retreats and pilgrimages around the world. Her teaching schedule and other information can be found at www.AmyMiller.com.www.AmyMiller.com
results.name: Transforming Anger and Depression

results.description:
Benvenuto Cellini was a celebrated Renaissance sculptor and goldsmith - a passionate craftsman who was admired and resented by the most powerful political and artistic personalities in sixteenth-century Florence, Rome and Paris. He was also a murderer and a braggart, a shameless adventurer who at different times experienced both papal persecution and imprisonment, and the adulation of the royal court. Inn-keepers and prostitutes, kings and cardinals, artists and soldiers rub shoulders in the pages of his notorious autobiography: a vivid portrait of the manners and morals of both the rulers of the day and of their subjects. Written with supreme powers of invective and an irrepressible sense of humour, this is an unrivalled glimpse into the palaces and prisons of the Italy of Michelangelo and the Medici.

Although most of Cellini's works in precious metals have been melted down, one surviving gold salt celler, which he completed for Francois I of France, and a number of major sculptures have secured his reputation as one of the finest Italian artists in the generation after Michelangelo. But he is most celebrated for his autobiography, which chronicles with unflagging energy and force one of the most tempestuous lives and one of the largest egos in all of history. Cellini served dukes, bishops, cardinals, and kings and queens of several nations, and he quarreled with them all, including two popes, one of whom, by Cellini's account, tried to murder him. He confesses to several murders himself, at least one rape, a notorious prison-break, innumerable fights and feuds. He also claims a pivotal role in defending Rome against invasion. From its first appearance in 1728 (150 years after his death), this portrait of a fanatical individualist helped define our notion of the Renaissance. The vigorous translation by John Addington Symonds is superbly realized by British narrator Robert Whitfield, successfully bringing to tape Cellini's unforgettable story.
results.name: Read The Autobiography of Benvenuto Cellini

After meetup drinks sponsored by Gecko Health Innovations (<a>www.caretrx.com).</a>

Gecko Health Innovations is developing biomedical and sensor technology to help people with chronic diseases, starting with Asthma and COPD. We have a successful Android app with our primary product, CareTRx, and an accompanying iOS app on the way. We were acquired by Teva Pharmaceutical Industries in 2015 to be their primary tech team for all future e-health, connected device innovation, and we need talented people who share our vision of making this happen through cool, innovative, accessible technologies.
