Thursday, March 24, 2016 | 7:30 pm - 8:30 pm


Still thinking about that comment someone made? Still hanging onto those past hurts? Still clinging onto fixed ideas about how things should be done?Just as a bird has to let go of the branch in order to fly, in the same way, we also need to let go... So, what are you holding onto that's holding you back?Let go and free up your resources to focus on what's important. Let go to move on and make way for the new.Even though this idea isn't new, the reality of doing it is something else. Why is it so hard to let go?
Join us to understand the why, the when, and the how of letting go and moving on.
results.name: Letting Go, Moving On

results.description:
Guess what! Sex Positive Boston took February off, and now that March (SPRING!!!) is here, we are back in full awesomeness!

When attending please let me (Nicole Mazzeo) know you heard about the event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup. Thanks!

The Discussion Topic

This edition of Sex Positive Boston will be a space to air out an social justice or sex-positive frameworks / messages / ways of doing things that have rubbed you the wrong way or left you feeling confused. You'll have a chance to explore your thoughts and feelings about the thing(s) that come(s) up for you, and hear the perspectives of other people in the group. We may disagree with each other, and that is OKAY! It will be interesting to hear how different people (who likely share similar values about sexual freedom) may have very different experiences with and reactions to certain concepts.

I especially want to explore concepts that you DON'T already have a conclusion for (i.e. it feels weird to you, but you're not sure if you agree/disagree, don't understand it enough, etc.) Let's figure this stuff out together! (Or at least explore it further, possibly without finding clear answers...) :)

Here's an example to explain what I mean: I often hear people say that if you believe in gender equality, you should identify as a feminist, because the defintion of a feminist is someone who believes in gender equality. While I think this message is often coming from a good place, it doesn't really sit well with me. I see feminism as a social and political movement that has a flawed history and consists of lots of different people, many of whom might share beliefs that someone who believes in gender equality might not identify with. So I think there are plenty of legitimate reasons that a person who believes in gender equality might not want to call themself a feminist, and it might be unhelpful to demand that they use that label. (While this is my reaction, I woul love to hear and consider other people's thoughts on this.)

That was just the first expample that came up for me, but this discussion is intended to be about lots of topics, not just that one. So don't worry if that one doesn't resonate with you!

I have plenty of other examples that could probably fill the whole discussion, but I want to hear and explore what comes up for you!

We will also ask ourselves: How do we work for a common goal (a culture of sexual acceptance) within a movement where we disagree on some things?

We will also reflect on appreciating all of the good that these movements have done, while recognizing that they are not perfect.

Show-and-Tell

Following the discussion, we'll have a show-and-tell of any sexual acceptance related projects anyone is working on. Feel free to bring your project (or information on your project) for show-and-tell, if you have one.


Who should come?

All are welcome. This is for people of all genders, races, ages, etc. Feel free to invite people!


Donations

This is a free event. You are welcome to donate to Pleasure Pie for organizing the event, but it is totally cool not to donate.

Safer Space

Sex Positive Boston strives to be a safer space. We will share what that means to each of us and come up with some guidelines during this meeting, but for now you can check out some guidelines we've used in the past here: http://www.pleasurepie.org/safer-space-guidelines.html


Accessibility

This event is taking place at The Meeting Point, a social justice-based healing center in Jamaica Plain. The space is wheelchair accessible and has gender-neutral restrooms.

Updates

Join the Sex Positive Boston Facebook group here:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/sexpositiveboston/

You can also RSVP and invite friends on the Facebook event page: https://www.facebook.com/events/1000156583383778/
results.name: Sex Positive Boston March Discussion!

results.description:
Cuddle Party is a 3 hour workshop experience where participants engage in communication exercises, explore touch in a non-sexual space, experience personal exploration and intimacy, and have fun with like minded friends from the community.

Nurturing and consensual loving touch is good for maintaining healthy blood pressure, a strong nervous system and a balanced emotional health. One’s ability to connect with and develop greater trust in others is emphasized during the group exchanges during Cuddle Party’s. Self-care is a cornerstone of Cuddle Party experience.

As seen on CBS’s the DR’S - 

http://thedoctorstv.com/videolib/init/6154

Cuddle Party is a formal, non-sexual event that offers participants an opportunity to explore intimacy with like-minded others. In a relaxed environment, that upholds personal boundaries and maintains a professional atmosphere, at all times, one is encouraged to engage in communication and touch, in a non-threatening, share-affirming environment.

Cuddle Party is a holistic, social environment, that attracts fascinating people from all walks of life. It provides a special and unique opportunity for connection, learning and growth. Come cuddle with us!

About Cuddle Party from Monique:

I have facilitated 100′s of Cuddle Parties. I am as passionate about the Cuddle Party experience today, as I was the first one, over five years ago. YES! It helped me reclaim my voice and I am passionate about helping others do the same.

Cuddle Party experiences teach participants, they alone create their own safety container. How did it change my life? When I was growing up and received a NO, it felt like I was being rejected. The result was my emphasis on being nice, being lovable and being unconditionally available. The profound learning came when I realized my unyielding YES’s became a subconscious inability to trust another person’s YES, without their own personally vocalized NO!

I am very appreciative and honored by the courage shown by those who have clear boundaries, and an ability to voice their YES and NO decisions without guilt, shame or fear. It gives me the confidence to ask for what my own heart desires, instead of censoring myself, knowing the receiver of my request has the voice and courage to embrace or withdraw, based on their own perimeters. “Thank you for taking care of your self”

After the Welcome Circle, Reid will offer a mini version of his speed flirting class, to help break the ice and dive us into getting to know one another.

Speed-Flirting is a rambunctious, social event for men, women, humans of all ages. The usual definition of flirting as just “a sexual thang” limits our ability to engage with people playfully. What if flirting meant “increasing the fun and play in any interaction?” Perfect for singles, couples, and entire communities, Speed-Flirting gives us the tools to go deeper than just a wink and a smile… 

Speed-Flirting will teach you to:

Break the ice with ease and confidence.

Make your dating and relationship life pressure-free.

Say No without feeling guilty.

Keep people from misunderstanding your intentions.

Relate with rejection gracefully and leave people feeling better for having met you.

Get anyone to make the first move.

Join sex and relationship educator Reid Mihalko (creator of the pop-culture phenomenon Cuddle Party) for an exciting and comical evening of flirtation. Add more aliveness to your existing relationships. Make new friends in the most exciting way possible. 

Speed-Flirting features a series of structured games and exercises with lots of easy-to-apply tools for breaking the ice, overcoming awkward moments, and for deep-connection through play. 

IMPORTANT CUDDLE PARTY NOTES:

BRING: Comfortable PJS, Blankets, Pillows and any kind of soft fluff to enhance your experience.

PLEASE BE ON TIME: Make certain to account FOR TRAFFIC AND PARKING.

Doors lock at 7:15. The opening Welcome Circle is for introductions and to go over the rules of Cuddle Party. This is an important aspect of the Cuddle Party experience and creates a safe container for all participants. It is essential that everyone be on time.

Love Exchange $35 per person


RSVP HERE: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/speed-flirting-and-official-cuddle-party-with-reid-mihalko-monique-darling-tickets-19901729609


Tickets are $40 per person at the door (IF not sold out)

About Your Facilitators:


Monique Darling, workshop facilitator extraordinaire has led over 800 workshops in the past 5 years. She is the founder of Juicy Enlightenment an organization dedicated to empowering people who are questioning the assumptions of how their life should be and to offering tools for self expression that create trust, inner knowing and wisdom to enjoy the life they have. Monique has been featured on TLC and The Dr’s as well as various radio shows, podcasts and magazines across the USA. She specializes in helping others reclaim their power and natural sensuality by transmuting fear and repression into courage, self-love and freedom. Her primary purpose is helping folks bring out their vulnerability, energetic embodiment and fearless relating.She guides from a place of understanding and her natural exuberance is infectious! She is available for private sessions, experiential workshops and Cuddle Parties. Learn more about Monique by going to 

juicyenlightenment.com

 or track her whereabouts at 

whereintheworldismoniquedarling.com

Sex and relationship expert Reid Mihalko teaches adults how to create more self-esteem, self-confidence and greater health and satisfaction in and out of the bedroom.

Using humor, insight and solid information, Reid appeals to audiences of all orientations, backgrounds, ages and identities. He’s one of the only male sex and relationship experts touring the country today who can speak pragmatically to nearly all areas of sexual self-expression, intimacy, dating and relating. Reid’s mission is to give men and women new tools to transform their love lives into fulfilling, satisfying, and sustainable expressions of self.


Reid has appeared on CBS’ The Doctors, Oprah’s Our America with Lisa Ling on OWN, Bravo’s Miss Advised, the Emmy award-winning talk show Montel, Fox News, VH1, Showtime’s Penn & Teller’s Bulls**t!, on NPR, Sirius’ Maxim Radio and Cosmo Radio, and in Marie Claire, GQ, Details, Seventeen, People, Newsweek, The Washington Post and The National Enquirer, as well as media across the globe in twenty-seven countries and at least fourteen languages.

Reid has also been a writer and producer on a number of films and television projects about sex and relationships, and consults regularly behind the scenes with producers and writers as an expert on subjects ranging from infidelity and sex addiction to dating and marriage, from jealousy and non-monogamy to gender dynamics and sexual tips and tricks.

For Reid, the skills it takes to make relationships healthy and turn mediocre sex into great sex are learnable by everyone. The question is: Do you have the courage to be the change you want to see in the bedroom?

Follow Reid on Twitter at @ReidAboutSex
results.name: SOLD OUT! Speed Flirting & Cuddle Party with Reid Mihalko & Monique Darling

Come spend a Thursday evening with one of NYC's best as he performs with Taylor Ketchum (Gotham Comedy Live) and local favorite Nick Chambers in this intimate 175-seat blackbox theatre! Tickets: http://bit.ly/1R80GAO

Andy Sandford Bio:

Andy Sandford is a comedian who got funny in Atlanta, GA and is now based out of New York City. In 2015, Andy made his late night debut on CONAN, which was included in The Laugh Button’s “Top 5 Late Night Stand-up Debuts of 2015.“ In 2014, Andy released his album, Me the Whole Time; which made several “best of” lists, including Splitsider’s “9 Best Standup Specials & Albums of 2014.“ Andy also played an animated version of himself on Adult Swim’s Aqua Teen Hunger Force. Brooklyn Magazine named Andy one of “Brooklyn’s Funniest People,” and Rooftopcomedy.com bestowed him the Silver Nail Award, given to the “top 8 up-and-coming comedians in the country.” And despite all of this, he has managed to remain humble.

In the Fall/Winter (September - April), we have scrimmages every Thursday night (except holidays) starting at 9:00 pm at the Simoni Skating Arena in Cambridge, Massachusetts.
All players of all skill levels are welcome. Come and skate with us, or just stop by to meet the players and learn more about Boston Pride Hockey.

results.description:
The Babson Healthcare Forum is an annual student-organized event bringing together speakers from across the Healthcare industry for a day of keynote speeches, panel discussions, and networking opportunities. This one-day event usually attracts 100+ attendees from industry and academia.

This year's event, titled Evolving Health Care and Life Sciences: Local and Global will focus on the evolving dynamics in the local and global healthcare sector. We will be discussing cutting-edge developments in personalized medicine, lifestyle & wellness, and patient care. The conference provides a platform for healthy debates surrounding these topics and provides an excellent opportunity for new business ideas and professional development.

The day's activities will feature keynote speeches, panel discussions, and a networking social event at the conclusion of the talks.

8:00am - 9:00am Registration & Coffee

9:00am - 9:10am Opening Remarks
William B. Lamb, Dean, F.W. Olin Graduate School of Business

9:10am - 10:05am  Opening Keynote Address

10:05am - 11:05am Panel I: Personalized Medicine 
Richard Donahue, M.D. - Founder, Personal Health MD

11:05am - 11:20am Coffee Break

11:20am - 12:20pm Panel II: Digital Health & Wellness
Carlos Rodarte - Director, Wearables & Biosensors, PatientsLikeMe
Cris De Luca - Johnson & Johnson Innovation Center
Gena Koufos - Clinical Advisor & Program Manager, Boston Children's Hospital

12:20pm - 1:20pm Networking Lunch

1:20pm - 2:15pm Afternoon Keynote
B.S. Ajaikumar, M.D.
Founder & Chairman
​Healthcare Global Enterprises﻿

​2:15pm - 3:00pm Tiny but Mighty: Startups Changing Healthcare

3:00pm - 3:20pm Coffee Break

3:20pm - 4:20pmPanel III: Innovating Patient Care
​Ronen Rozenblum - Founder & Director, Innovative Healthcare Practice Technology, Brigham and Women's Hospital
4:20pm - 5:15pm Jane Rhodes - Senior Director, New Initiatives, Innovation Hub, Biogen  

5:15pm - 6:45pm Closing Keynote
R. Ripley Martin
VP & Head of Strategy, Health Systems
Head of Strategic Marketing, Healthcare Informatics
Phillips

Networking Reception

​Price $25- $60.

REGISTER: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/13th-annual-babson-healthcare-life-sciences-forum-registration-21357987315?aff=eivtefrnd

results.description:
Walk through Boston on Good Friday, March 25, 2016, praying the Stations of the Cross at churches. Make reparation to God for the sin of abortion, whether we participated in it actively or by our silence,  or if we just want to comfort His Sacred Heart.

Walk peacefully and prayerfully. Please bring rosaries rather than signs.

Join us on Good Friday morning! 

Walk with us and tell a friend.

Please put this notice in your church bulletin today, and pray for us!

CONTACT: Colbe Mazzarella,[masked], [masked]

WayOfTheCrossForLife.org


* We stop at the Paulist Center, St. Thomas More Chapel, St. Anthony's Shrine, St. James, and Holy Trinity. Our last stop is the Cathedral of the Holy Cross at 1400 Washington Street, a short walk from the Orange Line’s Chinatown stop or Back Bay stop.

Or find a parking space near the Cathedral and go to the bus stop near the Cathedral’s front steps. A 5-minute bus ride ($2.10) brings you near Government Center. Our procession brings you back to the Cathedral.

In addition to the FinTech Sandbox Demo Day festivities, Boston FinTech Meetup members are invited to a VC Panel Discussion on Friday, March 25th, which will focus on the growing complexity of the funding landscape. FinTech venture capitalists and startups who are navigating this environment will share insights and solutions on how to successfully raise funds as the venture industry returns to the "old normal".

The panel will be moderated by  FinTech Sandbox Advisory Board Member Bruce Wallace, Digital Officer at Silicon Valley Bank. Panelists include: David Jegen, Partner F-Prime Capital; Gareth Jones, Co-Founder & General Partner FinTech Collective; John Fawcett, Founder & CEO Quantopian; and Mike Nugent, Cofounder & CEO Bison.

If interested, please reserve your ticket on our Eventbrite page here.  RSVPs on the Meetup website will not be honored.

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball.

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Friday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
This walk is on a paved path through the woods. This path is stroller friendly or you could carry your child. It is a little hilly, but appropriate for most fitness levels. We alternate walks between the inner and outer loops which are both under 3 miles. It usually takes less than an hour. We walk past a playground too, so we could stop and play there for a while. Afterwards, we sit at the picnic tables under the trees by the visitor center and feed our babies, chat, etc. 

We will meet outside the visitor center in the upper parking lot on the Saugus side of the park, past the Kasabuski Skating Rink.  There are bathrooms with a changing table in the visitor center too.

Running late?  No prob. We'll wait about 15 minutes before starting the walk.  Running really late? You can always meet up with us at the picnic tables next to the visitor center after we finish the walk.  

***By popular demand this is set as weekly event.  If the weather is bad we can change it to a different day or skip the week.

results.description:
A collaboration of the Harvard Food Law Society and Food Literacy Project
March 25th and 26th, 2016, 


Harvard Law School, Cambridge, MA

REGISTER NOW
Early bird rates through February 25th.

This year's Just Food? conference will examine the relationship between people and land, primarily through agriculture and food. We will explore the legal, moral, policy, health, historic and environmental aspects of our domestic and international food system, with a focus on the intersection of land and justice. The conference will bring together scholars, farmers, activists, practitioners, and other authorities to discuss the growing concerns about who has access to land, how agriculture changes land, and who is marginalized or dispossessed by our current system. Our goal is to educate attendees, empower them to make changes, and engage them in a larger dialogue about food.

For a tentative conference schedule and the list of speakers and poster sessions, check out https://foodbetter.squarespace.com/schedule/

Keynotes speakers include:
Smita Narula on Land Rights.
Jo Guldi on Historical Legacies of Land: the Oppressed and Dispossessed.
Anuradha Mittal on the Growing Natural Resource Grabs in the Third World.
Also Janie Hipp, Director of the Indigenous Food and Agriculture Initiative at the U. of Arkansas School of Law; Debora Nunes Lino Da Silva, MST member from Northeast Brazil; Tess Desmond Lowinske, Director of Harvard’s Committee on Ethnicity, Migration, and Rights

Panels topics will include:
Indigenous Land Rights
Urban Agriculture
Land Access, Tenure and Transition
International Land Struggles
Ecological Impacts of Modern Agriculture
And more!

The event will start on Friday (3/25) at 2:00 p.m. and Saturday (3/26) at 8:00 a.m.

We do not want the cost of registration to prohibit anyone from attending. We have a limited number of registration scholarships available. If you feel the registration fee is a financial burden that would prevent you from attending, please email [masked] with the subject "Conference Scholarship." Please include a short paragraph about why you would like to attend the conference. 

 
Register now: http://justfood2016.eventbrite.com
Find out more: https://foodbetter.squarespace.com/food-justice-conference/
Join us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/events/675757809232750/
Contact us: [masked]
results.name: Just Food? Forum on Land Use, Rights and Ecology

results.description:
The last several months we've been on a quest to find a new venue for Meet and Greet One More Time.  We've been concentrating on the Newton Center area since it's on the T for our public transit folks and centrally located with lots of available parking for those of us driving.  We've been looking for the right balance of ambiance and good food/drinks, reasonably priced.

I think we found it!  The Deluxe Station Diner.  It's located in the old train station building that's right at the Newton Center T stop.  It has a very comfortable feel to it; warm and friendly.  We sit at the bar if we have a small group.  We grab a table  for a larger group.

They have a number of interesting specialty drinks.  I have tried the Blueberry Lemonade and the Apple Pie.  Believe it or not, those are both vodka drinks.  They were both very good and reasonably priced.  The kind of drinks that you need to be careful with because it's easy to forget there's alcohol in them.

I'd classify the food as "comfort food".  We've had the burgers, mac & cheese, curried chicken, meatloaf, chicken pot pie, and fish & chips.  Everything has tasted great and was reasonably priced.

Several large municipal parking lots are nearby. Meters are free after 6:00 pm.

MBTA: Green Line, “D” train, Newton Center stop. When you come up the stairs from the train tracks, you are on Union Street. The diner is inside the old brownstone Union Station.

Bus #52 from Watertown Square (www.mbta.com for schedule and exact route).

Driving:

From the Mass Pike (east-bound):
Take exit 17 and make your first right after the set of lights, onto Centre Street. Follow Centre Street approximately three miles through. Take a left onto Langley Road and park in the parking lot on the left or park any where on Langley Road. (There are many other different options to park around Newton Center).

From the Mass Pike (west-bound):
Take exit 17 and go straight off the ramp. After the ramp, you will go through two sets of lights. After the second set, turn left at the sign that says "Newton Centre/Boston." You will be making a 180-degree turn and should stay in the right lane. Take your first right after the 180-degree turn onto Centre Street. Follow Centre Street approximately three miles through. Take a left onto Langley Road and park in the parking lot on the left or park any where on Langley Road. (There are many other different options to park around Newton Center).

From Route 9:
Take the Newton Center/Centre Street Exit. Follow Centre Street until you reach Beacon Street. Take a right onto Beacon Street and park in the parking lot on your left or on Beacon Street.

results.description:
Welcome to the Cash Game Atoll, where the blinds are .25/.50 and the game is dealer's choice or no limit holdem. There is no minimum buyin and the max is 200 bb ($100.) There is no rake, tipping, donation, or seat fee. House rules are posted below:

If it's your first time at one of my games RSVP on meetup then text, email, or call to confirm your RSVP and receive the address. If you RSVP and no-show without changing your RSVP, then you have likely taken a seat from someone else, made me very sad, and I put your name on the shit list. Don't do it. If you're running late I appreciate hearing from you.  Doors open at 6:25, and if you havent arrived or contacted me about running late by 7:00, I will begin offering seats to the waitlist.  I reserve the right to cancel the game if we can't get enough players.

-1 chip=call

-Verbally declared actions are binding

-No string bets or splashed pots

-Don't discuss hands as they are ongoing. Talking about hands or action is allowed only are when heads up, and only by the 2 players remaining in the pot.

-Hands must remain on table or not more than 12 inches from the edge of the table and must be visible to all players.

-Everyone makes mistakes but strive to pay attention so you act in turn in a timely fashion.

-Cut-off shuffles

Meetup at MetroRock Gym in Everett, offering both toprope and lead


Meet at the left-side hexagonal picnic table next to the bench and cubbies.

I (Jens) will go up to the picnic table area from 7 - 7:15 PM to meet people who prefer to show up at the regular MeetUp time. Please check  the whiteboard near the bathrooms for a description of what I'm wearing. If anyone else arrives early, please write "MEETUP" and your name & what you are wearing on the Whiteboard.

If you have not already done so, please post a clear face picture of yourself on your profile so that I and other members can recognize you.

If arriving later, just come find us on the walls. Hopefully you can recognize me (see "Event Host" right) from my picture.

If you've never climbed here before, you'll need to take & pass a belay test for rope climbing. Call the gym or see the website below for more info. Full-access Day Pass $22. Bouldering-Only Pass $18. Free pizza for students.

More info and directions: http://www.metrorock.com/
results.how_to_find_us: At the picknic table next to the cubbies
results.name: MetroRock FRIDAY

results.description:
FABULOUS FRIDAYS AT CIMC!

Come for an evening of LGBTQ meditation practice, discussion, tea & cookies at Cambridge Insight Meditation Center. 

Taught by our fearlessly awesome teacher, Madeline Klyne, this program is suitable for all levels. If you have never tried meditation, are a beginner or have had a practice for years, this evening is for you. It includes meditation instruction, sitting meditation, walking meditation, an inspiring LGBTQ-focused Dharma Talk, discussion, tea, and cookies.

Come make new friends and help build the OutBreath community! This is CIMC's signature LGBTQ event.
results.name: Evening for LGBTQ Practitioners

results.description:
THERE ARE JUST A FEW SPACES LEFT FOR THIS FEARLESS RELATING WEEKEND INTENSIVE!

REGISTRATION OPTIONS:

$397 WHOLE WEEKEND INTENSIVE: FEARLESS RELATING IN LIFE, LOVE (INCLUDES SAT NIGHT PUJAFEST) AND SEX (SUNDAY)

Fri 7-10pm

Sat 10:30am-5pm

Sat night 7-11pm

Sun 11am-5pm


$245 MINI INTENSIVE: FEARLESS RELATING IN LIFE AND LOVE (INCLUDES SAT NIGHT PUJAFEST - otherwise SOLD OUT) Fri 7-10pm

Sat 10:30am-5pm

Sat night 7-11pm

$200 MINI INTENSIVE: FEARLESS RELATING IN LIFE Fri 7-10pm

Sat 10:30am-5pm

SECURE YOUR TICKET HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/fearless-relating-weekend-intensive-with-reid-mihalko-monique-darling-tickets-19758347750

We expect this multi-MeetUp event to sell out, so be sure to secure your spot via eventbrite! (RSVPs on MeetUp do not reflect accurate registration numbers, nor do they secure your spot.) Come join us in Boston as two top teachers in the fields of sexuality, vulnerability, and self-acceptance weave their diverse perspectives into a weekend retreat like you have never experienced before.

Enigmatic comedian Reid Mihalko will show you ways to simplify your life, lessen emotional paperwork, and face your fears with humor and confidence.

Monique Darling, mistress of the weave, Goddess of self acceptance, will open you to an immense playground of possibilities you had not dared to consider. And will bring together the juiciest morsels of various teachers to help you internalize the lessons to your depths, and to help you find the greatest love of your life. Yourself.

Benefit from the blending of their unique experiences, approaches, and insights regarding skillful communication to get to your no without fear to uncover your yes, releasing your armor and becoming more vulnerable to discover an inner strength you did not know you have, and the ability to laugh in the face of your greatest fears.

If you could have anything, do anything, what would you choose? What do you really want? What is keeping you from having it? Is someone else better qualified? better looking? more financially stable? Do you have “problems”? What if every limit you have, every chain that binds you, is only there because you believe it is? What if the limits disappear, the chains dissolve?. Your life is alive with an abundance of possibilities, opportunities, and potential all you have to do is be willing to say "yes".


So much of the fear and hesitation in life comes not from the self, but from fretting about what others may think,or what they will say or whom they might share it with afterwards rather than being able to enjoy the moment. Another set of fears come from passed-down beliefs that we accept without questioning them.

What if you could make decisions and follow your heart...follow your body and your desires without worrying about what others thought? What if you were fearless in relating – first, to yourself and then, to others?

We all have feelings of ferocity and tenderness, but we must feel safe in order to be vulnerable and intimate with another. Part of that safety is being confident in our own ability to say ‘NO’ and take a stand for our boundaries. Only then can we play in the realm of our true ‘HELL YES!’

Come join us for a unique weekend of exploration around such topics as:

*How do we establish boundaries and create safe space for ourselves to explore with others? *Shifting paradigms from blame, shame, guilt & judgement, to love, acceptance, understanding and presence.

*Factors that promote or inhibit intimacy:

*The power of no and boundary (understand why your “no” says more about you than your “yes”)

In this workshop you will learn, play, and practice: - To ask for what you want, skillfully, without attachment to the response.

- To honor, respect, and be grateful for the answer “no”, and still be hopeful for the answer “yes”.

- To be honest and vulnerable about your wants and desires without shame, without deflection, without armor.

- To hold space for someone who has not yet learned these skills.

- To own your fears, instead of them owning you.

- To not be afraid to be the one who loves the most

- To learn to be even more vulnerable when you want to isolate or close down.

- Release shame and haunting memories

- Modalities of communication: verbal and non verbal

You will gain tools and leave with the ability to relate with everyone in your life with more ease, grace, and blissful contentment from your own center.

SECURE YOUR TICKET HERE:

https://fearlessweekendma.eventbrite.com/

Are you confused about dating, mating, and relating in the 21st Century?

Dating, marriage and the reasons we stay in relationships have changed a lot since the days of our great grandparents. Join us for this humorous, frank and informative, intensive workshop where sex and relationship expert Reid Mihalko boils down over 150,000 conversations he’s had about sex and relationships and walks us through his best thinking and advice on making sex, dating, relationships and mating work!

Participants will leave this interactive workshop experience discovering:

• Tools to determine if someone is a good or horrible fit for you…

• Communication Skills to ask for what they want and how to avoid past relationship mistakes…

• A few of Reid’s and Monique’s “black belt” relationship tips and tricks!

Then, let Monique Darling, Consent Geek Extraordinaire, lead you through all of the tools, tips, tricks and how to uplevel the questions you are asking yourself and others to truly be able to find and live from your own "Hell Yes"!! Monique has been leading Cuddle Parties (just facilitated her 346th)all over the country, which are 3 1/2 hours of practicing this concept.

How amazing would it be to live life offering every "no" without apology and every "yes" without being ashamed? Learn that it really isn't about anyone else, it's about tuning in and taking care of you, and then you can relate with ease and joy with others, wherever they are at.

Learning better sexual technique will boost your sexual self-confidence, raise your self-esteem, and make you more confident and competent in sex and love! Being THAT kind of person is attractive in AND out of the bedroom! Part of the weekend will cover how to increase your sexual self-confidence ten-fold and start becoming a more attractive, self-expressed and fearless person in all your relationships!

Through no nudity, interactive, hilariously "edutaining" demonstrations, you will learn:

• How to use fantasy to turbo-charge a lover's orgasm... • How to listen to your partner's body in bed... • How to create your own "sexual positions decoder ring" so you naturally "think" about lovemaking in an exciting, Kama Sutra way! •How to slow down sexual experience for greater pleasure

•Learning to STOP judging ourselves and our partners

•Understanding how to expand our own sexual energy and our PLEASURE Body

•Opening to Full Body Energy Orgasms

•The different stories you and others are telling about your sexual identity •Developing Emotional and Sexual Safety for Intimacy

• 5 tips that will give you oral sex super powers! • 3 Powerful Perspectives that will help you understand pleasure and orgasm, and how to give and receive both! • 3 ways to use your hands sexually that will drive your partner wild AND leave you feeling more confident as a lover! • 2 BIG differences between penises and vulvas, and 1 thing that's the same that will make you 10-times better in bed... • And still more!

If you ever begin to understand who you are, you could not possibly ever compare yourself to another, to envy, wish to impress, to BE different than you are. For in the beauty, wonder, and awe at discovering how magnificent “your” puzzle pieces fit together, at the ever changing infinite ways YOU shift, dance, I Need Your Love - Is That True?: How to Stop Seeking Love, Approval, and Appreciation and Start Finding Them Insteadeave together, each one so unique, so extraordinary, it would take an entire lifetime to only just begin to discover. Yet so often we abandon the quest of self discovery, to follow another, or to invest in relationships, doing what we have been told is the “right” way to be. The greatest freedom that we could ever express or imagine, is by simply giving ourselves permission to gently keep returning to us and we can transform the world by simply being 100% ourselves.


Come with an open heart and a willingness, a longing, to bring your stories into the light, so that they can stop you running away from your shadow.

There will be times, over the weekend, when the atmosphere will be sensual and energetically sexual. All activities and exercises will be guided and are always optional. You can participate in the workshop solo, with a partner and in small groups. All participants are asked to practice with each other, or by oneself, in whatever manner supports you best. Many options will be offered to support each individual experience.

Set your sights on registering for this breakthrough weekend, and get a two for the price of one deal by paying only what it ordinarily costs to learn from just one of these facilitators.

So say ‘HELL YES’ to discovering ‘YOU’

SECURE YOUR TICKET HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/fearless-relating-weekend-intensive-with-reid-mihalko-monique-darling-tickets-19758347750


“Helped me to understand what it means to live orgasmically.” Janice

“Nothing has been the same since. I learned about my energetic self and others. Fear has passed away in my life and been replaced by curiosity” Alyson

ABOUT YOUR FACILITATORS:

Sex and relationship expert Reid Mihalko of www.ReidAboutSex.com helps adults create more self-esteem, self-confidence and greater health in their relationships and sex lives using an inspiring mixture of humor and knowledge. Reid’s workshops and college lectures have been attended by close to 40,000 men and women. He has appeared in media such as Oprah’s Our America With Lisa Ling on OWN, the Emmy award-winning talk show Montel, Dr. Phil’s The Doctors on CBS, Bravo’s Miss Advised, Fox News, in Newsweek, Seventeen, GQ, The Washington Post, and in thirteen countries and at least seven languages.

Monique Darling, workshop facilitator extraordinaire has led over 800 workshops in the past 5 years. She is the founder of Juicy Enlightenment an organization dedicated to empowering people who are questioning the assumptions of how their life should be and to offering tools for self expression that create trust, inner knowing and wisdom to enjoy the life they have. Monique has been featured on TLC and The Dr’s as well as various radio shows, podcasts and magazines across the USA. She specializes in helping others reclaim their power and natural sensuality by transmuting fear and repression into courage, self-love and freedom. Her primary purpose is helping folks bring out their vulnerability, energetic embodiment and fearless relating.She guides from a place of understanding and her natural exuberance is infectious! She is available for private sessions, experiential workshops and Cuddle Parties. Learn more about Monique by going to juicyenlightenment.com or track her whereabouts at whereintheworldismoniquedarling.com
results.name: Fearless Relating in Life, Love and Sex Weekend w Reid Mihalko & Monique Darling

results.description:
Friday, March 25th, join us at 7pm for our Good Friday Tenebrae Service.

Set in candlelight, the service interweaves scripture readings about Jesus' last days with instrumental music and songs. After each reading a candle is extinguished, leaving us in darkness at the end of the service.

The service will also include a time of reflection where we seek healing for suffering and loss in our lives.

The joy of Easter is often felt more deeply after experiencing the tragedy and despair of Good Friday.

All are welcome to join us for this sacred time of worship and reflection.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the sanctuary of the building, right inside the front doors.
results.name: Let candlelight and readings transport you into the Good Friday story

group.name: Building Community @ Common Street Spiritual Center

results.description:
Just getting started in DJ culture? Maybe you're looking to brush up on your skills with a "Best DJ in Boston" award-winner? That's why Leah is here. Meet up and get to know your skills better and learn from one of the best!

Leah Vitiello is a magic mystery. Just kidding. She’s a kid who had this idea that it’d be super rad to become a DJ. She didn’t know of any female DJ’s, and ever since she was a young’n, Leah has been drawn to things that were outside the box. “I liked to stand out and let my freak flag fly I suppose. I always had a love for music, and I was lucky to have parents who exposed me to amazing sounds.”

Leah knew how to cue up a record on her father’s Technics 1200 by the time she was 6 years old. It’s that very collection of vintage records that started her first crate and her first bedroom set-up. Leah started going to clubs by the time she was 16, and fell in love with the nightlife culture and hasn’t budged from it since.
results.name: Beat-Matching Basics and Building the Mix w/ DJ Leah V [Fri 3/25] #FREE

results.description:
We will be doing the OSHO® Kundalini Meditation, which is one of the OSHO® Active Meditations. This time, the meditation will take place in the larger studio - Studio 1 and hopefully, with less distractions. We will also talk about other Osho Active Meditations and discuss which ones would participants prefer to do in the subsequent meetings! Please be aware that the meditation will start promptly at 7 PM and no late arrivals will be admitted in the meditation space. Please wear comfortable and loose clothing. Price for participation: $10

Description:

This meditation is an effective way of unwinding and letting go at the end of the day. Being fully immersed in the shaking and dancing of the first two stages helps to “melt” the rocklike being, wherever the energy flow has been repressed or blocked. Then that energy can flow, dance and be transformed into bliss and joy. The last two stages enable all this energy to flow vertically, to move upward into silence. 

Instructions:

The meditation is one hour long, with four stages.

First Stage: 15 minutes

Be loose and let your whole body shake, feeling the energies moving up from your feet. Let go everywhere and become the shaking. Your eyes may be open or closed.

Second Stage: 15 minutes

Dance ... any way you feel, and let the whole body move as it wishes. Again, your eyes can be open or closed. 

Third Stage: 15 minutes

Close your eyes and be still, sitting or standing, observing, witnessing, whatever is happening inside and out.

Fourth Stage: 15 minutes

Keeping your eyes closed, lie down and be still.

Note about parking: 

A reasonably priced parking garage is located on Green Street, the next block after Green Street Studios, on the left side of the street. Address of the parking garage: 260 Green Street, Cambridge, MA


I look forward to seeing you in the meditation space!


OSHO is a registered trademark of Osho International Foundation, used with permission,

www.osho.com/trademark

Some material used here (images and text excerpts) is Copyright © OSHO International Foundation, 

www.osho.com/copyright

results.name: Relax, let-go and experience bliss!

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

7:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

7:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

7:20 - Play!!!!!!

9:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing.

Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a light or dark "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!
results.how_to_find_us: The field is right next to Alewife station on the Red Line. There is also plenty of parking provided no one else is using the field. (Not an issue in the winter.)
results.name: Friday Night Time Ultimate @ Russell Field

results.description: We had a great turnout last month! Come out and join us again at the Burren in the Back Room. There will be a table reserved for the MeetUp. The Social No. 11 plays from 7-9pm. Tickets cost more at the door so you might want to buy in advance. https://burren.showare.com/orderticketsarea.asp?p=10&a=1

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and shared energy. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in Boston?

At TurnON, we play three communication games (just talking, no touching), and you can participate at whatever level feels good to you. Imagine meeting new people in an environment where they feel comfortable to express themselves and challenge the edges of their comfort zones; a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation. That's what we have created.

TurnON events give you the opportunity to look deeper into yourself, through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses. What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to be authentic. It's like a giant exhale when the rest of the world is asking you to hold it in. In just an hour, you may even forget that you are in Boston.

TurnON Boston is an organization that teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON events are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without actually doing the practice. At the end of the evening, we will give you a brief description of the practice of OM and information on how to learn more.

$10, payable at the door.

Please arrive on time - we lock the door promptly at 7:40!

Limited non-resident parking is available alongside our building on Dudley Street, or plentiful metered spaces on Mass Ave are only one block away (and free after 6pm). We are a 10-minute walk from the Red Line at Davis Square.


 http://tedxtalks.ted.com/video/TEDxSF-Nicole-Daedone-Orgasm--2

results.description:
We will repeat a challenge from the fall to capture the Zodiacal Light. Images need to be taken during this event period, old photos don't count. This spring event is for evening people, the best time is an hour after sunset looking WEST. That makes it best to be found on the west coast, but can possibly be done in the east in dark spaces without cities west of you.


Zodiacal light is a faint, roughly triangular, diffuse white glow seen in the night sky that appears to extend up from the vicinity of the sun along the ecliptic (the apparent path that the sun takes across our sky). It is best seen just after sunset in spring, and just before sunrise in autumn, when the zodiac is at a steep angle to the horizon. Caused by sunlight scattered by space dust in the zodiacal cloud, it is so faint that either moonlight or light pollution renders it invisible. When looking west, the light slants to the left (south):


Below is a shot from October's light looking east.

In the northern hemisphere, the light appears as a faint cone of light above the eastern horizon before sunrise or the western horizon in spring. Its light intensity is greater than the Milky Way. Typically, the light is colorless, but in rare circumstances it can have blue, green, yellow, or red hues. If the conditions are right, it is easy to see the zodiacal light, but because it is so faint and occurs near the horizon, most viewers think they are seeing twilight or the light from a distant town (both of which we eliminate by shooting before civil twilight and over the ocean). It is best seen when the sun is between 18 and 12 degrees below the horizon, that means during astronomical twilight.


The best time in spring then is between 8 and 9 p.m. during the period 25-March to 7-April, before that it is too bright (sunset is around 7:00 p.m., in case you want to capture, that, too). Even though the light can be seen well in general in April, the moon will be out of the way only during that period of 25-Mar to 7-Apr (and again 24-Apr to 6-May). If you have PhotoPills (iToy) or PlanIt! (Android), these apps can show you exactly where the sun would come up, that is where you have to point your camera - typically due West (270°) to about 280°.


Here is more info about it on Wikipedia

and

some examples on Google:

Shooting settings are the same as for star points or Milky Way: wide open aperture (f/2.8 or wider), maximum exposure time in seconds is determined as 400/focal length in mm (300/FL for cropped sensor cameras) and ISO between 1600 and 3200 (6400 is usually too noisy and diminishes the beauty of the faint light). Compose to have something interesting in your foreground, could be silhouettes, as long as it is not a plain straight beach. Try some dunes, or if you plan to go into the mountains, that works, too.


Post pictures here as you get them.


Suggested locations: west of Springfield or Deerfield, elevated location are dark. Mt Greylock may work, but has the glow of Albany due west. North of Keene and west of Manchester, NH is also dark, and so are the southern White Mountains (Mt Moosilauke) and large parts of VT.
results.name: Challenge: Capture the Spring Zodiacal Light - 25-March through 7-April

Child Alice is an orchestral epic for 82 instrumentalists and amplified soprano soloist that explores the world of Lewis Carroll's Alice's Adventures in Wonderland. results.description:
FRIDAY ANIME BOSTON 2016 ITADAKIMASU DINNER

@8:00PM

WHERE: WAGAMAMA

{inside of the Prudential mall, next to Pinkberry)

If you are attending the Anime Boston 2016 convention on FRIDAY please join us for a "ITADAKIMASU DINNER" so that you can meet the other members of The Boston Japanese Films & Anime Social Group! We'll look over the schedule together,  and meet members who want to attend activities together during the convention!

Hope to see you there!

Amarley Garrison Quaye, Co-Organizer

Cell Phone Number[masked]

"Anime Boston is a three-day convention held annually in Boston, Massachusetts, USA under the supervision of the New England Anime Society. Our focus is to celebrate and promote Japanese animation, comics, and pop-culture.

This event has been a cornerstone of the North East Anime Convention circuit since our inaugural event in April, 2003. Following unprecedented growth, we quickly outgrew the space in the Boston Park Plaza Hotel and moved to the Hynes Convention Center in 2005. The Hynes Convention Center and Sheraton Boston have allowed us to grow in ways we could not have imagined since the idea was first conceived.

While the main focus on Anime Boston has always been Japanese animation and comics, we have expanded to include other aspects of Japanese pop-culture: J-Pop, J-Rock, and live-action Japanese media. We have also delved into Japanese history and traditional culture, thus encouraging people to develop a more well-rounded perspective.

Over 350 staff members work to make this convention possible. On top of that, everyone is a volunteer; no one gets paid for what they do. We all participate because we are also fans (and might be a little crazy). We work year-round to prepare for each convention; in fact, planning for the next year begins before the previous one is even over! Our staff is incredibly diverse and comes from all walks of life and experiences. The hard work and dedication of our staff members ensures that we put on the best show possible.

Of course, Anime Boston would not be the success it has become without the support of its members and fans. Starting with a staggering 4,000 members in 2003 (an incredible feat for a brand new convention), by 2012 we had expanded to welcome more than 22,000 people over the weekend. The majority of our panels are actually presented by members who just want to share their passions with the larger community. Having members organize some of the programming for Anime Boston gives everyone a sense of community and belonging at our event.

We, the staff of Anime Boston and the New England Anime Society, thank you for taking interest in our convention. Your excitement helps energize everyone and spreads the word to new people. We hope to see you there!"
results.name: FRIDAY ANIME BOSTON 2016 ITADAKIMASU DINNER

AcousticaElectronica

What happens when a bunch of classically trained musicians, dancers and actors decide to put on a late-night dance-club show? You get something like AcousticaElectronica, which blends elements of electronic and classical music, dance, circus arts and immersive theater with the infectious energy of a nightclub to bring you an unforgettably unique experience. It starts with live musicians playing the work of established and up-and-coming composers, joined onstage by resident DJ Danny Satori. The dancers bring in their blend of ballet, jazz and modern movement, while the aerialists wow the audience with their artistic flyovers. With a lower mezzanine ticket, you can see the show from an exclusive raised dance-floor area, with standing cocktail tables and your own server so you can skip the bar lines.

"It's like Cirque du Soleil meets a rave but a better description would be totally unbelievable. This was the COOLEST blend of theatre, all types of music, dance, opera and creation of an atmosphere in a space that I have ever seen." Dig Boston IGNITE YOUR SENSES
Succumb to an awe-inspiring experience that stimulates all of your senses. AcousticaElectronica blends elements of electronic and classical music, dance, circus arts, and immersive theater with the infectious energy of a nightclub to bring you an evening you won't encounter elsewhere. Don't believe us? Come feel for yourself.

You can get discounted Dancefloor tix for $12 (+$4 fee) at goldstar.com and if I send you an email referral, there is another $10 discount.

results.description:
"Cash Only" Film is a raw, heart-wrenching glimpse into Detroit’s insular Albanian community. It is also a timely reminder that buying into the American Dream often only yields crippling debt.


Friday, March 25, 2016

9:30 PM

Harvard Square
Cambridge, MA  Brattle Theater

40 Brattle Street
Harvard Square
Cambridge, MA

Five free tickets will be given (first ask, first serve). Please contact Erin K. A.S.A.P at [masked] or (978)[masked] if interested.  See who is going from the Boston Albanians network: https://www.facebook.com/events/2002985476593374/

There will be a Q & A with Nickola Shreli (Albanian Screenwriter and actor) and Malik Bader (director) after the "Cash Only" movie. Later, we will be going to O Sushi in Cambridge to hear to live music, socialize, and have drinks and appetizers. The Asian dishes are delicious and I love the Sushi.


Born and raised within tight-knit Balkan Detroit, screenwriter & actor Nickola Shreli plays Elvis Martini, a guilt-wracked Albanian widower and the ‘King’ of faltering landlords in Detroit. Elvis is neither an unlucky dad with a heart of gold, nor a pathological scumbag. He is deeply flawed, but Shreli imbues Elvis with unquestionable pathos even as his desperation graduates into irreversible criminality. As bookies and bill collectors come for their money, his good intentions give way to increasingly terrible decisions and absolutely untenable financial solutions that will culminate in a frantic race against the clock. 


For more info and the trailer, please visit: 


http://bostonunderground.org/films/cash-only/

About Dr. Dave Steuer
David R. Steuer received his Bachelor’s Degree in Latin Economics at Brigham Young University in 1995. He then received his DMD from the University of Louisville Dental School in 1999. Dr. Steuer then completed his residency training in Endodontics at the Harvard School of Dental Medicine where he performed a surgical externship at KLH Hospital in Graz, Austria. Dr. Steuer has practiced dentistry and Endodontics in the greater Boston area since[masked], and in Maine from then on.

Dr. Steuer served as Clinical Instructor at the Harvard School of Dental Medicine, was a cofounder of Oral Surgical Specialists, LLC, the founder of Luminescent Capital Partners, LLC, and served on the Board of Directors of Hemametrics Corporation (a medical research and products company sold to Fresenius). Among Dr. Steuers many adventures, he serves on the board of Health Science and Technology at the University of Southern Maine, and on the Medical Advisory Board for doTERRA (a health and wellness company). Dr. Steuer is an active member of the American Association of Endodontists and the American Dental Association.

results.description:
I know it's Easter weekend for some, but if anyone would like, I'd love to meet for coffee, conversation and of course a walk.  

Some things to ponder:

What are your goals?

What are some of the challenges you've faced on the road to living a healthier life?

What have you done to overcome these challenges?

What do you feel you need to learn to fulfill your goals?

Of course, included in all of this, is what are you most proud of? It's easy to talk about our failures, what we "should have done better," etc. Let's also talk about our accomplishments-what we're proud of!

I think sharing some of our story and listening to other's will help motivate, inspire and even offer new ideas that we can incorporate into our individual journey. 

***There's an Ironstrength workout on the Boston Common that starts at 10:30 am. It's free and for all activity levels. Look it up-it's sponsored by Marathon Sports.

results.description:
Carlisle’s Great Brook Farm State Park consists of approximately 1000 acres and has over 20 miles of trails available, We'll start  skirting the meadow of the Litchfield Loop and then ascend  the ridgelines of Indian Hill, Stone and the Woodchuck Trail before crossing North Road into the swampy section and trek on the Beaver Loop. Tophet Loop and Heartbreak Ridge. We'll then cross through another meadows area via the Pine Point Loop as we make our way back to the parking area

The Musketaquid Native Americans are said to have  used the area for sacred sites. Also, seventeenth century cellar holes serve as landmarks in the areas formerly know as  "the city" where early English colonial settlers worked one of numerous mill sites. The park also features an active dairy farm. The farm and buildings comprise a classic eastern Massachusetts agricultural landscape. 


Please note that we'll meet @ the Visitors Center aka Interpretive Center. This is a different location/address from the park headquarters, ski touring center or farm complex, which all may show up as responses to your Google search.  Parking is $2.00. 

What you need to know:

 Estimated Distance: 6 - 8 miles (subject to change)


Terrain Difficulty: Easy/Moderate   This hike should be  suitable for  beginning hikers who keep fit doing other things. This rating typically describes hikes that are not flat but whose elevation gain is less than 500 feet per mile. For an easy/moderate hike, you should definitely be prepared for a lot of uphill walking. Overall the uphill sections will be  gentle  but there are some short steeper segments. Expect mud - embrace it!


Remember that the Difficulty Rating is for the terrain; not the hike itself. When determining if a hike is right for you, remember to factor in: terrain, distance, estimated pace, duration, weather prediction, driving time and your fitness level as well as your mood and frustration threshold.

Elevation Gain: estimated 500 ft. total


Hike Time: Estimated 5 hours. However, this is an estimate. Actual times vary greatly according to weather, trail conditions and the pace of the  group. Don't sign up if you've scheduled something later in the day. The Organizer is not responsible for getting you back in time.

Anticipated Pace: 2-2.5 mph or the pace of the slowest hiker

Hike Type:  Loop (actually a series of interconnected loops)

There is no way of knowing trail conditions ahead of time. Use your own judgement.

Anyone with recurrent "No Shows" , or who routinely drops out or about whom we have received complaints from fellow Trekkers will not be accepted. If you haven't hiked with us before, add yourself to the list if you can adhere to these basic prerequisites.

Please don't RSVP "Yes" unless you really intend to come. We are committed to being there for you. If you are not equally committed to being there then please don't sign up.

Please do not show up for an event unexpected or unprepared. Bring water (2 liters), hiking boots (not sneakers or trail runners) and lunch/snacks. Protect yourself against deer ticks and dress in layers.

We hike in light rain or light snow, but heavy rain or snow or any  extreme weather that renders hiking and/or driving conditions hazardous cancels.


This is a group event and participants are expected to follow the lead, stay together, stop at junctions or summits, and support all participants should circumstances require teamwork. We start together and finish together. If you decide to leave the group at any time, you are on your own.

NO DOS and NO GUESTS.  Have your guest join the group so they can agree to the liability waiver and attend an event.

Please remember that your Event Organizers  are volunteers, the event is free and we are all adults. The people who have the best times on these hikes are those who stay loose and roll with things as they happen. If you are expecting Daniel Boone as your leader, you’re barking up the wrong tree. If you need everything to run perfectly, this hike is not for you.

Short Version: This not an event for high-maintenance individuals.

By signing up and/or attending this hike you agree to the Liability Waiver Below:  

Remember: Your Event Organizers  are volunteers. You are solely responsible for your own safety and enjoyment. As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at http://www.hikesafe.com/ you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; the organizer(s) of this activity is a volunteer; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reason.

If you are offering or need a ride, post that on the message board. However, when responding please do so privately by clicking on the person's profile pick and clicking the "message" link.

Please keep your arrangements private and  off the Message Board/ For your safety don't post your phone number on it.

For driving directions and a downloadable trail map go to:

http://www.mass.gov/eea/agencies/dcr/massparks/region-north/great-brook-farm-state.html
results.name: Trek over the ridges and through the swamps of Great Brook Farm State Park

Learn how to protect your landscape from the voracious winter and gypsy moths. Boston Tree Preservation’s Peter Wild will discuss techniques to minimize damage caused by these perennial pests.

About Peter Wild: Peter is  the owner of Boston Tree Preservation, an organic-based tree care business founded in 1977; as well as one of the first to develop and use vermicomposting for fertilization, disease and insect pest management. 

About iFarm:  ifarm utilizes a restored 19th century farmstead to reconnect the individual with the earth. The goal is to provide diverse educational experiences that utilize core values of sustainability, rejuvenation, and thoughtful design which both individuals and communities can incorporate into their own environment, experiences and life.

results.description:
This is NOT flat terrain.


Meeting at outside the Visitor Center (at picnic table). Please arrive 15 minutes early. We start hiking on time; plan your travel accordingly.

This is a multi-group event, including Rhode Island outdoor adventurers. The pluses on my RSVP represent those attendees.


The Hike:

We will be hiking (2 hours, including a break at the top) the western section of the sanctuary to the summit Bluff Hill, then retrace our steps back. Good views to the west and south await us on Bluff Hill. The hike will be at a moderate pace over uneven rocky terrain with elevation gain.

There is a trail fee. Mass Audubon Members enjoy FREE admission. $4 for nonmember adults.

info about the park: http://www.massaudubon.org/get-outdoors/wildlife-sanctuaries/moose-hill

online trial map: http://www.massaudubon.org/content/download/8080/145429/file/moosehill_trails.pdf

After Hike, Food and Drinks:

After the hike, we will gather for food and drinks. Some options for the after hike event are:

* Mick Morgan, 973 Providence Hwy, Walpole, MA

RSVP Responsibility!


Only RSVP if you can go and update your RSVP (don't wait until the day of the event) if you can't make it.

I am only a volunteer. I will be waiting at the trail starting point, and I will be expecting you. I look forward to meeting you.

* No pets allowed on hike.

* Members only. No guests permitted.

* Members must have a valid photo.

* Adults only.


Gear and Dress:

* Hiking boots suggested.


* Dress appropriately for the weather conditions.


* Non-cotton clothing works best.  


* Bring water, snacks and any personal medicines and gear you may need as well.

FOUL WEATHER CANCELS.

You assume all risk associated with this activity.

Liability Waiver: As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at <a>www.hikesafe.com;</a> the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.


Directions to Hike:

From the north: Take Rt I-95 south to exit 10 (Coney St, Sharon, Walpole). Take a left off the exit and take the first right onto Rt 27 north (Walpole). Take first left on Moose Hill Street. Continue past The Trustees of Reservations (TTOR) Moose Hill Farm. Follow to the top of the hill and turn left onto Moose Hill Parkway. The parking lot is on the left.

From the south: Take Rt I-95 north to exit 8 (Main St, Sharon). Take a right off the exit and follow one mile. Take a left onto Moose Hill Street. Follow to the top of the hill and turn right onto Moose Hill Parkway. The parking lot is on the left.
results.name: 👣 Moose Hill Hike then Lunch

Roaming Photographer!

Afternoon Session Check in starts at  12:30 PM. The Dance start at 1:00 PM goes on until 3PM. 

Live DJ playing your favorate Top 40/ Hip Hop/ Edm/ Mashups & Internatinal songs 

 Cash bars serving top shelf liquor. There will be food available for Purchase at the Venu as well.

LED lights and dance floor!

Hi Urban Sketchers,

Even though it's officially spring, let's sketch the Somerville winter farmer's market. 

This weekly market offers the best locally grown and regionally produced agricultural items including vegetable produce, cheese, eggs, meats, fish, breads, pastries, chocolate, and wine. We feature rotating guest vendors each week, as well as live entertainment.

There will be plenty to sketch:

-fruit and produce, baked goods, etc...

-musicians

-vendors

The plan is to meet inside the Armory cafe at around 10:45-11am.  At 11am, we will disperse to sketch.  At 1pm, we will meet back in the cafe to share our work.

Please see the market website for additional info:

http://www.somwintermarket.org/

Hope to see you there!

-Eric

results.description:
Join Trustees and the City of Boston to kick off the growing season! Enjoy a day full of learning, networking and fun. Choose from more than two dozen workshops covering an array of topics including seed starting, composting, urban beekeeping, making sauerkraut, and community and youth organizing, and celebrate the winners of the ever-popular Community Garden Awards. Meet other gardeners (or wannabe gardeners) and learn about Boston-area agriculture, gardening, and environmental organizations through the information gallery. 

Walk-in registration starts at 11:00, opening plenary at noon. Keynote Address & Breakfast:
Dimensions of Change through Community Gardening
(New this year!)
9:30 – 10:30 AM, Trustees members: $15; nonmembers: $25

We are excited to welcome leading social entrepreneur Daniel Ross to this year's Gathering. Daniel is the CEO of Daisa Enterprises, specializing in supporting development of food and environmental enterprises and programs in underserved communities. He is also a Visiting Assistant Professor of Social Entrepreneurship at Hampshire College.
As the Executive Director of Nuestra Raices in Holyoke, MA he spent sixteen years developing projects relating to food, agricultue and the environment. He also served as the Chief Operating Officer of the Wholesome Wave Charitable Foundation Ventures where he worked to reinvent the world we eat in with innovative programs and policy solutions. Register here for keynote: http://www.thetrustees.org/things-to-do/greater-boston/event-23323.html
Want to present a workshop? Please submit your RFP here by Friday, February 26th: http://bit.ly/1nw3JFO

Michelle de Lima

results.description:
Are you Separated or Divorced, Considering Divorce, Or Currently in the Process of Divorce? Please join us for March's Divorce Basics Monthly Series: Divorce & Taxes. Shelia May, Masters of Taxation and CPA, will lead this month's timely and important event.

There is no cost for attendance. Complimentary refreshments and snacks will be provided. This is a multi-group event listed on other meetups, so attendance will be greater than the RSVP's on this meetup alone.

This event is intended to be partly informational, partly social, and totally empowering. Attendance to this event and information shared will be kept confidential.

Topic: Whether or not your spouse is reporting financial information accurately is often the main concern in the divorce process. Also, filing taxes in this situation and determining the consequences of settlement proposals can be confusing. Sheila will provide a handout of financial considerations for before, during and after the divorce process. She will discuss filing taxes during and after divorce, as well as hidden income.

This event is casual/interactive and not formal, which is a setting that prior attendees have really liked. We sit in a circle and the attendees have the opportunity to ask questions in the group setting, as well as ask the professionals questions one on one during the mix and mingle time towards the end. At this event, there will also be divorce attorney and mediator, David Kellem, and financial advisors, Bob Vona and Samantha Steer, to answer your questions.

When: Thursday March 24th 6:30 – 8:30 p.m. & Saturday March 26th 12 – 2 p.m. Both dates are the same event (Meetups listed separately). Choose the time convenient for you.

Similar Divorce Basics events at this location will be held every month on the fourth Thursday and fourth Saturday. Please check the calendar for these upcoming events:

•Thursday, April 28 & Saturday, April 30, 2016 (5th Saturday this month); Divorce Basics: How to approach dating again and in the online context – set up a profile and manage responses. With Susan D. Trotter, PhD

• Thursday, May 19 & Saturday, May 21, 2016 (3rd Thursday & Saturday this month, because of Memorial Day); Divorce Basics -- A Legal Overview of the Divorce Process. With David Kellem, Divorce Attorney and Mediator

• Thursday, June 23 & Saturday, June 25, 2016; Divorce Basics: The House -- Should you try to keep it or sell it; what to consider
results.how_to_find_us: Call or text Deanna at 508-333-3191 with any questions or for directions.
results.name: Divorce Basics: Divorce & Taxes

results.description:
I (and several of you) read this book long before I had my daughter and absolutely loved it and am excited to read it again and discuss it with you ladies! Here is a description from Amazon.com:

"The runaway New York Times bestseller that shows American parents the secrets behind France's amazingly well-behaved children


When American journalist Pamela Druckerman had a baby in Paris, she didn't aspire to become a "French parent." But she noticed that French children slept through the night by two or three months old. They ate braised leeks. They played by themselves while their parents sipped coffee. And yet French kids were still boisterous, curious, and creative. Why? How?

 
With a notebook stashed in her diaper bag, Druckerman set out to investigate—and wound up sparking a national debate on parenting. Researched over three years and written in her warm, funny voice,Bringing Up Bébé is deeply wise, charmingly told, and destined to become a classic resource for American parents."
results.name: Let's meet for coffee and discuss "Bringing Up Bébé"

results.description:
Are you curious about programming or thinking about pursuing a career in software engineering? 

Then RSVP on this meet-up page for this 2-hour Intro to Coding class happening in the Boston area at CIC Boston. Learn the basics of programming, do hands-on exercises, and enjoy some food and drinks while meeting new people. All for free!

The class is being taught by MakerSquare, which runs some of the top coding schools in the country.

Class officially starts at 1:30pm, but please arrive at CIC Boston by 1pm to enjoy pizza, drinks and to mingle with your fellow classmates. We will end at 4pm, with the last 30 minutes being an optional Q&A session.

What will I learn during the class?

This beginner ­level class will contain several instructor-guided exercises. The class will cover the following topics:

   1. Overview of programming 

   2. Intro to data & data structures

   3. Basics of functions

We ask that you read the Prerequisites section before the start of class and bring your own laptop (Windows, Mac or Linux) with Google Chrome installed.

What is MakerSquare Boston?

MakerSquare is a three-month full-time school for software engineering. By teaching computer science fundamentals and modern web languages like JavaScript, we prepare students to join top flight engineering teams.

We have campuses all over the country, and are excited to be opening a campus in Boston. The free Intro to Coding class is to introduce more people to the wonderful world of programming and to get the community excited about the launch of our full-time class in Boston in July 2016!

Questions? Email us at [masked].
results.name: Free Intro to Coding Class (Sat March 26, 1-4pm)

There will be no face to face meetup unless we reach 50 RSVPs by Thursday of the week. You must be enrolled in one of the 10 FREE courses below or similar courses. 

Our past experience is that 20% of the RSVP shows up in the weekend meetings. Considering that, unless we have about 50 RSVPs, we cannot have a face to face meeting. Please use the questions / answers / discussions below for now. While asking questions, please make reference to the name of the course and the related module within the course. 

Cousera offers the following classes towards obtaining highly valuable knowledge/skills in Data Science Specialization. It is sometimes hard to work on the exercises and homework without the help of an expert.  Receiving one-on-one help from an expert can improve the commitment of finishing the program with accelerated learning. With that in mind, we are experimenting with the following service.


An expert (MS or PhD in Statistics) will answer any question free that takes less than 10 minutes to solve. There are nominal fees for one-on-one interactive help.  Please use the following link to request for help, or just email [masked] or call[masked]-8864.

http://www.tutorteddy.com/courses/coursera-course-help.php

The Data Scientist’s Toolbox

R Programming

Getting and Cleaning Data

Exploratory Data Analysis

Reproducible Research

Statistical Inference

Regression Models

Practical Machine Learning

Developing Data Products

Data Science Capstone
