results.description:
Come join the Food Business Association for a FREE networking event in North Cambridge for food industry professionals, entrepreneurs, and those interested in joining the industry.

We have had these events each month for 3 years with great success and now have around 500 Members in the group. Even if you are just thinking about starting a small food business, this is a great place to meet people in the industry and learn more!

You must RSVP in order to attend, space is limited!
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/networking-for-food-entrepreners-food-business-association-tickets-22930987200

Find out about all of our events by joining the FBA for free here: http://eepurl.com/bBja89

Hope to see you there!
Kim Courtney

www.FoodBusinessAssociation.org
results.name: Free Networking for Food Entrepreneurs

results.description:
Here are just some of the things you can get out of these meetings:

• Access to thousands of dollars of courses, software, and other resources

• Advice on overcoming a business or marketing obstacle you're facing

• Accountability, so you actually get your work done and turn your dreams into reality

• Ideas and inspiration to help you make something new or improve what you already have

• Meet awesome people who enjoy talking about this stuff as much as you do

Or, you can be a fly on the wall. No pressure at all. Feel free to drop in to just listen and see what internet marketing really looks like from people who are actually doing it.

These meetings tend to run between 1.5-2 hours. Here's the way it works:

7:00pm Join the meeting here:

https://hangouts.google.com/hangouts/_/daviddrayton.com/weeklyautomatedincomemastermindmeeting

First, new members introduce themselves, and existing members talk about what goals they hit and didn't hit in the past week. This part usually takes about 15 minutes. The remainder of our time is spent helping one of our members overcome any problems they may be facing by giving them a chance to sit on the "Couch of Insight!" Long story short, with our dozens of years of experience and our huge diversity of current business projects, we give them brutal but constructive feedback on their plans and current projects, helping them get insights they could never get from their friends and family alone.

Anyone can join. It doesn't matter where you are, how older you are, or even what stage of your business you're in. Our regular members include everyone from total beginners who are just getting their feet wet all the way up to serial entrepreneurs who are already making six-figures or more in their spare time doing this stuff.
results.how_to_find_us: Google Hangouts.  Join by clicking the link in the description.  Give it a shot before the meeting to make sure you can join without any problems.  Let me know if you're having trouble.
results.name: Weekly Remote Mastermind Session

results.description:
The average human requires a minimum of eight and a half hours of sleep each night to function normally. During sleep, the body recovers, rebuilds, and detoxifies from the day’s damages and stresses. Sound, deep sleep is vital to health — but many people today find it difficult to get to sleep at night, and what sleep they do get is rarely as refreshing as it should be. They find themselves taking sleeping pills to get to bed at night, and relying on caffeine or other stimulants to get through their days . . . does this sound familiar?

Hops, one of the more popular herbs due to its use in flavoring beer, is in fact a potent hypnotic.

In this class, we’ll discuss simple herbal preparations and rituals that can aid even veterans of the infomercial purgatory in their search for restorative slumber. Herbs offer natural, non-addictive support for the release of stress and tension at the end of the day, and gentle sedation to help us ease into peaceful sleep, allowing us to return to our instinctive sleep cycles. No sheep-counting required! If time allows, we’ll also look at the use of herbs for enhancing dream recall and lucid dreaming. Wednesday, March 30th, 2016
7:00pm – 9:00pm
25 St. Mary’s Court, Brookline

The fee for this class is $20.

RSVP by filling out our contact form, emailing us at [masked], or calling[masked]-5274.

We also have a recorded lecture on this topic available for download.
results.name: Simple Herbs for Sound Sleep

They find themselves taking sleeping pills to get to bed at night, and relying on caffeine or other stimulants to get through their days . . . does this sound familiar?

Hops, one of the more popular herbs due to its use in flavoring beer, is in fact a potent hypnotic.

In this class, we’ll discuss simple herbal preparations and rituals that can aid even veterans of the infomercial purgatory in their search for restorative slumber. Herbs offer natural, non-addictive support for the release of stress and tension at the end of the day, and gentle sedation to help us ease into peaceful sleep, allowing us to return to our instinctive sleep cycles. No sheep-counting required! If time allows, we’ll also look at the use of herbs for enhancing dream recall and lucid dreaming.

Wednesday, March 30th, 2016
7:00pm – 9:00pm
25 St. Mary’s Court, Brookline

The fee for this class is $20.

RSVP by filling out our contact form, emailing us at [masked], or calling[masked]-5274.

We also have a recorded lecture on this topic available for download.
results.name: Simple Herbs for Sound Sleep

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

7:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

7:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

7:20 - Play!!!!!!

9:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing


Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a dark or white "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!
results.how_to_find_us: The field is right next to Alewife station on the Red Line. There is also plenty of parking provided no one else is using the field. (Not an issue in the winter.)
results.name: Wednesday Night Time Ultimate @ Russell Field

results.description:
Now we begin our discussion of 2 Corinthians: "But thanks be to God, who in Christ always leads us in triumphal procession, and through us spreads the fragrance of the knowledge of him everywhere" (2:14).  

Perhaps one of the most troubled churches we see in the New Testament while also being one of the most blessed, Corinth is an example of God's grace not to give up on a struggling church, as well as an example of how to be the church God wants.  1 and 2 Corinthians, Paul's back-to-back letters to the saints in Corinth, provide great insight into unity, maturity, church growth, humility, love, the resurrection, church discipline, salvation, faith, and a number of essential topics for those seeking God.  Come join us in our study of 2 Corinthians!
results.how_to_find_us: We're meeting on the second floor in the Kuumba Library.  Enter the main entrance on Clarendon Street, take the spiral staircase to the right, and we're in the room to the right.  See you there!
results.name: Study 2 Corinthians

Join us this month as we play Pandemic Legacy, rated best board game of 2015 by BoardGameGeek. The rising tension keeps you on the edge of your seat and this unique setup makes every game feel different.

"The world is on the brink of disaster. In Pandemic Legacy, your disease- fighting team must keep four deadly diseases at bay for a whole year. Each month will bring new surprises, and your actions in each game will have repercussions on the next. Will you let cities fall to the diseases? Will your team be enough to keep the viruses at bay for a whole year? Craft your own unique Pandemic experience with Pandemic Legacy."

results.description:
This figure drawing session is geared toward beginners, but anyone is welcome. For those who are intersted, I will go over the basics of figure drawing and suggest drawing approaches to get you started.  The model will be lightly clothed.

The cost is $20, cash, check or credit card when you arrive. Also, you can bring your own supplies, or for $5 you can use supplies in the studio.

Some equipment available: tables, drawing boards and clips. Three standing easels and three table easels. 

Do register on this meetup site as space is limited.

PLEASE, DO NOT PARK in the Bakery parking spaces. They are open till 8:00pm.
results.name: Drawing and Painting from the figure, clothed

results.description:
Welcome to the weekly BKBS Wednesday meet up. Please join us at 7:00 PM by the 3rd table station in the middle of the top roping / lead area. If you are still by the bouldering wall, keep on walking.

We usually meet there for about 10 mins, and then team up in groups of 2 or 3 for top-rope climbing.

If you know that you'll be late, let us know in the comments section, and maybe tell us what you'll be wearing, so we can look out for you. 

BKBS (http://www.bkbsomerville.com/Classes/. If you have a working knowledge of how to belay, you will need to be belay certified before climbing on the ropes. Please flag down a BKBS employee and let them know you need to take a belay test. To pass such a test you will need to display how to tie a double figure eight knot with a fisherman's backup, safely belay a climber up a wall, catch them on a fall, and lower them to the ground safely.

What equipment do I need?  You will need at the bare minimum a harness and climbing shoes. Rentals are available. Grigri devices are provided at every station.

What if I can come, but at a different time?  Just let everyone know you want to climb at a different time and use the community to find a partner for those dates / times.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): 

Day Pass - $25 (Students $20) 
10 Pack - $225 (Students $180)

(Membership Pricing also available)

RENTALS: 

Shoes - $5 
Harness - $5 
Chalk Bag - $2 
Full Gear Kit - $11
results.how_to_find_us: The third table in the middle of the climbing area between 7:00-7:10 PM. It's the table in the middle of the TR \/ Lead area.
results.name: Brooklyn Boulders Somerville Wednesday

results.description: Dear meditators....you might want to join us for a high level energy clearing to raise your vibration and expand your energy field, promoting peace and awareness of your Divine Self. This is Level 1 RYSE. Everyone loves this group clearing! Levels 2-4, leading up to your initiation to your soul's blueprint, may be received privately. RYSE means Realizing Your Sublime Energies.  It clears  the chakras, aura, male/female balance and more.  RYSE brings about your next level of harmony, health and wholeness. Expect to feel more peaceful, balanced, present and joyful.  Please rsvp, but walk-ins are always welcome!  I hope to see you then!

results.description:
This Meetup is intended for Intermediate/ Intermediate + level players with firm understanding of game strategy. Should be able to have a good grasp of skills (passing, setting, hitting) and be able to move around to cover areas of the court. Play should consistently be bump-set-spike. If you'd like to play, please do the following: Click RSVP or send an email to Dmitry Grenader using the following URL: 


http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=10855876

Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email. We will do our best to make sure the event is co-ed, have setters, and incorporate a couple new members who want to join as well. The location for this volleyball meetup is at the JCC of the North Shore, 4 Community Road, Marblehead, MA[masked] |

This event is free if you are a member of JCC. If not, it's a one-time $8 membership fee that is valid for a day. As always, please remember: - Respect the RSVP system (Don't show up expecting to play without a confirmed RSVP) - If it looks like you won't be able to make it or will run late please cancel your RSVP in time for someone else to join. Event day/last minute cancellations and no shows will jeopardize your participation in future events.

results.description:
Join 50 to 80 or 100 dancers any Wednesday at Dance Freedom!!

We are the original barefoot weekly dance, continuously running for 44 years, that has spawned hundreds if not thousands of other dances around the world.

In a drug, alcohol, and shoe-free environment, we've been making friends and sharing safe and juicy dances for decades. Come join the fun!! Discover the joy of dancing in a totally non-judgmental atmosphere, where anything safe and respectful goes... dance by yourself, in a group, with a same or opposite sex partner, or even just chat and enjoy watching.

First time visitors are welcomed heartily, and get in for half price! Otherwise, you decide what to pay in a range from $10 to $20, or less later in the evening as the event nears its end (information on late admission discounts is at the door). Our friendly dancers range from utterly new at it to very skilled dancers in funk, rock, salsa, modern, jazz, hip-hop, African & Latin and swing, tango, contact improvisation, and our own unique spontaneous creations! Dance with or alongside amazing dancers from local dance troupes as well as with ordinary good-hearted rug cutters. At work they may be doctors, lawyers, programmers, massage therapists, expressive therapists, artists, students, dog walkers, scientists, or anything else, but at heart they all love to dance.

The music runs the gamut: funk, world music, soul & r&b, house, trance, hip-hop, salsa, yoga music, jazz or swing, reggae, disco, you name it! Each DJ from our rotating list has a unique style, but we try to include something for everyone in every set. We keep a good balance in the music: familiar with unusual, timeless with current, melodic with drum-based, and positive lyrics with instrumentals--in all kinds of rhythms & styles! In any given evening, the world music parts of our dance are likely to include at least 3 or so of the following... African, Latin, Indian, Middle Eastern, Caribbean, zydeco, gypsy and much more. You'll hear everything from basic party music to very danceable songs with socially conscious lyrics, but you won't be hearing anything sexist, racist, violent, hating or otherwise divisive.

Start with a soothing stretch and warm up at 7:30, connect with the group and start to boogie at 7:50 with our first DJ of the evening, take a brief break at 8:50 for community announcements and a short unique performance or workshop (or chatting & stretching in a way that doesn't interfere), then cut the rug again by 9:15 at the latest with the evening's second DJ, till 10:30--plenty of time for a great workout and some feel-good inspiration and respiration and perspiration!

At the beginning of each half of the evening's music, everyone who wants to gathers around a centerpiece to hold hands, and dance in a winding chain together to a song with uplifting, connective (or at least beautiful and hypnotic) slow to medium tempo rhythms. (This dance was created from out of a drumming circle on the Cambridge Common in the sixties, after all, and some of that great political and community spirit still lives on here.) Then, it's all dance music, generally building in tempo to a crescendo, slowing down again for some more melodic and slow dance songs for a few minutes, then gradually building to a second crescendo. The second half of the evening's dance follows roughly the same pattern with a different DJ and style, and ends with another circle dance for those who enjoy it.

Dancers are always welcome to help with set-up or take-down, and get in free for doing so! It's a great chance to get to know the community better and be serviceful, as well as to save money and help us to be around for another 42 years... Welcome! For more information, E-mail: [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Opposite the Cambridge Common, see the Sheraton Hotel w/the big red letters COMMANDER on top.  Enter the stone church just left of hotel, @ entrance closest to hotel.  Follow the hall straight, left and right to the desk to sign in.
results.name: Dance Freedom Chad &  Steve

results.description:
Wednesday, March 30th Limelight Comedy Club is very proud to present Quincy Jones, seen on Ellen, NPR, GQ and more.

See Quincy's recent appearance on Ellen here: http://ellentube.com/videos/0-kkj1n36x/

Quincy Jones is a Los Angeles based comedian who can make any room fall in love with his craft, much like his namesake. Quincy moved to LA from Seattle to pursue a career in stand-up four years ago. Within his seven years of stand-up experience, Quincy has toured the country and played the best stages in LA, including shows with comedy legends like Bill Burr. In 2013 Quincy Jones was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of fame (while our Quincy was drinking a Chai with almond milk in a Korea Town coffee shop). On July 3, 2015 Quincy was diagnosed with stage-four Mesothelioma cancer. He was given one year to live. Quincy is currently not strong enough to work his regular barista day job; his energy can only last a few hours at a time. On nights that he is feeling well he makes sure to hit the stages around Los Angeles, spreading laughter, as he preps for this stand-up special film shoot. While on stage, Quincy is cancer free.

Quincy will be filming his one hour comedy special at the Teragram Ballroom in Los Angeles on April 4, 2016. We at Limelight Comedy Club are thrilled and honored to have Quincy headline in preparation for the special.

Get tickets for Quincy's show at Limelight Comedy Club on March 30th here: http://bit.ly/1pT3buw

100% of this show's proceeds will be donated directly to Quincy's Kickstarter. Doors open at 7 pm, show at 8pm.

Limelight Comedy Club is Boston's newest stand-up comedy venue, featuring the hottest up and coming comics working today. Located in the heart of Boston's theater district, Limelight Comedy Club is just steps away from the iconic Wilbur Theater, and hosts weekly shows every Wednesday night featuring top talent. $5. 18+.
results.name: Quincy Jones (Ellen, GQ, NPR) Headlines at Limelight Comedy Club

results.description:
https://plus.google.com/events/c0oegddjuh07utbrq1mv6vm1rfg

Ellen Jaffe JonesThe Veg Coach

Creative Cook / Author / Consultant 
From our test kitchen to your home kitchen 

OK, show of hands.  How many of you eat quinoa as a side dish? 
Most cooks use the protein-rich grain as a substitute for rice. 
But, I've got a treat for you today.  It's a recipe for Quinoa crisp chocolate balls! 
What a way to reward yourself for following a healthy lifestyle. 

Find it below.

Consider this too as a tasty approach to getting people interested in coming to one of my FREE cooking classes. This week, Wednesday at 9pm EST, I'll be doing a free class prepping and serving 2 recipes from my book "Eat Vegan on $4 a Day." Bring any questions to our Google Hangout: 

https://plus.google.com/events/c0oegddjuh07utbrq1mv6vm1rfg

Happy cooking,

Ellen Jaffe Jones 
The Veg Coach 
http://www.vegcoach.com

Buy my books:

Paleo Vegan

Eat Vegan on $4 a Day

Kitchen Divided - Vegan Recipes for Semi-Vegan Households

This is a Quinoa crisp chocolate bar you might find at your local health food store.  
But, my recipe lets you create your own Quinoa chocolate treat.  

It'll satisfy your chocolate cravings and it's so easy to make.  

The recipe is below. 

You're Going to Love This!  

Quinoa Crisp Chocolate Treats 
by Ellen Jaffe Jones 

INGREDIENTS 

1 cup vegan chocolate chips 
1/2 cup puffed quinoa 
4 teaspoons coconut oil 
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional) 

PREPARATION INSTRUCTIONS 

1 cup vegan chocolate chips 
1/2 cup puffed quinoa 
4 teaspoons coconut oil 
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional) 

Melt chocolate chips in a double-boiler, or place in a microwave-safe bowl and heat for about 60 seconds until the chips develop a slight sheen. 
Place all ingredients in a medium pot (or add to the double-boiler) and over medium heat, and stir constantly for about 5 minutes taking care not to burn the chocolate. 
Form small balls and place on a non-stick cookie sheet. 
Refrigerate for at least 60 minutes before serving. 
For those wanting to reduce fat intake, this can be made without the coconut oil, but make sure the chocolate chips are completely melted.

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
